# Crawl4AI v0.6.0 Release Notes - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Crawl4AI v0.6.0 Release Notes
=============================

We're excited to announce the release of **Crawl4AI v0.6.0**, our biggest and most feature-rich update yet. This version introduces major architectural upgrades, brand-new capabilities for geo-aware crawling, high-efficiency scraping, and real-time streaming support for scalable deployments.

* * *

Highlights
----------

### 1\. **World-Aware Crawlers**

Crawl as if you’re anywhere in the world. With v0.6.0, each crawl can simulate: - Specific GPS coordinates - Browser locale - Timezone

Example:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-1) CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-2)     url="https://browserleaks.com/geo", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-3)     locale="en-US", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-4)     timezone_id="America/Los_Angeles", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-5)     geolocation=GeolocationConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-6)         latitude=34.0522, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-7)         longitude=-118.2437, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-8)         accuracy=10.0 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-9)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-0-10) )`

Great for accessing region-specific content or testing global behavior.

* * *

### 2\. **Native Table Extraction**

Extract HTML tables directly into usable formats like Pandas DataFrames or CSV with zero parsing hassle. All table data is available under `result.media["tables"]`.

Example:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-1-1) raw_df = pd.DataFrame( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-1-2)     result.media["tables"][0]["rows"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-1-3)     columns=result.media["tables"][0]["headers"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-1-4) )`

This makes it ideal for scraping financial data, pricing pages, or anything tabular.

* * *

### 3\. **Browser Pooling & Pre-Warming**

We've overhauled browser management. Now, multiple browser instances can be pooled and pages pre-warmed for ultra-fast launches: - Reduces cold-start latency - Lowers memory spikes - Enhances parallel crawling stability

This powers the new **Docker Playground** experience and streamlines heavy-load crawling.

* * *

### 4\. **Traffic & Snapshot Capture**

Need full visibility? You can now capture: - Full network traffic logs - Console output - MHTML page snapshots for post-crawl audits and debugging

No more guesswork on what happened during your crawl.

* * *

### 5\. **MCP API and Streaming Support**

We’re exposing **MCP socket and SSE endpoints**, allowing: - Live streaming of crawl results - Real-time integration with agents or frontends - A new Playground UI for interactive crawling

This is a major step towards making Crawl4AI real-time ready.

* * *

### 6\. **Stress-Test Framework**

Want to test performance under heavy load? v0.6.0 includes a new memory stress-test suite that supports 1,000+ URL workloads. Ideal for: - Load testing - Performance benchmarking - Validating memory efficiency

* * *

Core Improvements
-----------------

*   Robots.txt compliance
*   Proxy rotation support
*   Improved URL normalization and session reuse
*   Shared data across crawler hooks
*   New page routing logic

* * *

Breaking Changes & Deprecations
-------------------------------

*   Legacy `crawl4ai/browser/*` modules are removed. Update imports accordingly.
*   `AsyncPlaywrightCrawlerStrategy.get_page` now uses a new function signature.
*   Deprecated markdown generator aliases now point to `DefaultMarkdownGenerator` with warning.

* * *

Miscellaneous Updates
---------------------

*   FastAPI validators replaced custom validation logic
*   Docker build now based on a Chromium layer
*   Repo-wide cleanup: ~36,000 insertions, ~5,000 deletions

* * *

New Examples Included
---------------------

*   Geo-location crawling
*   Network + console log capture
*   Docker MCP API usage
*   Markdown selector usage
*   Crypto project data extraction

* * *

Watch the Release Video
-----------------------

Want a visual walkthrough of all these updates? Watch the video: 🔗 https://youtu.be/9x7nVcjOZks

If you're new to Crawl4AI, start here: 🔗 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xo3qK6Hg9AA&t=15s

* * *

Join the Community
------------------

We’ve just opened up our **Discord** for the public. Join us to: - Ask questions - Share your projects - Get help or contribute

💬 https://discord.gg/wpYFACrHR4

* * *

Install or Upgrade
------------------

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.6.0/#__codelineno-2-1) pip install -U crawl4ai`

* * *

Live long and import crawl4ai. 🖖

Crawl4AI CLI Guide

-----------------

*   [Advanced Features](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#advanced-features)
    
*   [LLM Q&A](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#llm-qa)

*   [Best Practices & Tips](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#best-practices--tips)
    

Installation
------------

The Crawl4AI CLI will be installed automatically when you install the library.

Basic Usage
-----------

The Crawl4AI CLI (`crwl`) provides a simple interface to the Crawl4AI library:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-1) # Basic crawling [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-2) crwl https://example.com [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-4) # Get markdown output [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-5) crwl https://example.com -o markdown [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-7) # Verbose JSON output with cache bypass [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-8) crwl https://example.com -o json -v --bypass-cache [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-10) # See usage examples [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-0-11) crwl --example`

Quick Example of Advanced Usage
-------------------------------

If you clone the repository and run the following command, you will receive the content of the page in JSON format according to a JSON-CSS schema:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-1-1) crwl "https://www.infoq.com/ai-ml-data-eng/" -e docs/examples/cli/extract_css.yml -s docs/examples/cli/css_schema.json -o json;`

Configuration
-------------

### Browser Configuration

Browser settings can be configured via YAML file or command line parameters:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-2-1) # browser.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-2-2) headless: true [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-2-3) viewport_width: 1280 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-2-4) user_agent_mode: "random" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-2-5) verbose: true [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-2-6) ignore_https_errors: true`

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-3-1) # Using config file [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-3-2) crwl https://example.com -B browser.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-3-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-3-4) # Using direct parameters [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-3-5) crwl https://example.com -b "headless=true,viewport_width=1280,user_agent_mode=random"`

### Crawler Configuration

Control crawling behavior:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-1) # crawler.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-2) cache_mode: "bypass" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-3) wait_until: "networkidle" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-4) page_timeout: 30000 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-5) delay_before_return_html: 0.5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-6) word_count_threshold: 100 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-7) scan_full_page: true [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-8) scroll_delay: 0.3 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-9) process_iframes: false [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-10) remove_overlay_elements: true [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-11) magic: true [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-4-12) verbose: true`

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-5-1) # Using config file [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-5-2) crwl https://example.com -C crawler.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-5-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-5-4) # Using direct parameters [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-5-5) crwl https://example.com -c "css_selector=#main,delay_before_return_html=2,scan_full_page=true"`

### Extraction Configuration

Two types of extraction are supported:

1.  CSS/XPath-based extraction:
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-6-1) # extract_css.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-6-2) type: "json-css" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-6-3) params: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-6-4)   verbose: true`
    

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-1) // css_schema.json [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-2) { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-3)   "name": "ArticleExtractor", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-4)   "baseSelector": ".article", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-5)   "fields": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-6)     { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-7)       "name": "title", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-8)       "selector": "h1.title", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-9)       "type": "text" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-10)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-11)     { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-12)       "name": "link", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-13)       "selector": "a.read-more", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-14)       "type": "attribute", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-15)       "attribute": "href" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-16)     } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-17)   ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-7-18) }`

1.  LLM-based extraction:
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-1) # extract_llm.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-2) type: "llm" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-3) provider: "openai/gpt-4" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-4) instruction: "Extract all articles with their titles and links" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-5) api_token: "your-token" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-6) params: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-7)   temperature: 0.3 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-8-8)   max_tokens: 1000`
    

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-1) // llm_schema.json [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-2) { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-3)   "title": "Article", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-4)   "type": "object", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-5)   "properties": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-6)     "title": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-7)       "type": "string", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-8)       "description": "The title of the article" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-9)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-10)     "link": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-11)       "type": "string", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-12)       "description": "URL to the full article" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-13)     } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-14)   } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-9-15) }`

Advanced Features
-----------------

### LLM Q&A

Ask questions about crawled content:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-1) # Simple question [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-2) crwl https://example.com -q "What is the main topic discussed?" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-4) # View content then ask questions [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-5) crwl https://example.com -o markdown  # See content first [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-6) crwl https://example.com -q "Summarize the key points" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-7) crwl https://example.com -q "What are the conclusions?" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-9) # Combined with advanced crawling [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-10) crwl https://example.com \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-11)     -B browser.yml \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-12)     -c "css_selector=article,scan_full_page=true" \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-10-13)     -q "What are the pros and cons mentioned?"`

First-time setup: - Prompts for LLM provider and API token - Saves configuration in `~/.crawl4ai/global.yml` - Supports various providers (openai/gpt-4, anthropic/claude-3-sonnet, etc.) - For case of `ollama` you do not need to provide API token. - See [LiteLLM Providers](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/providers)
 for full list

### Structured Data Extraction

Extract structured data using CSS selectors:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-11-1) crwl https://example.com \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-11-2)     -e extract_css.yml \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-11-3)     -s css_schema.json \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-11-4)     -o json`

Or using LLM-based extraction:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-12-1) crwl https://example.com \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-12-2)     -e extract_llm.yml \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-12-3)     -s llm_schema.json \ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-12-4)     -o json`

### Content Filtering

Filter content for relevance:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-1) # filter_bm25.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-2) type: "bm25" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-3) query: "target content" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-4) threshold: 1.0 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-6) # filter_pruning.yml [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-7) type: "pruning" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-8) query: "focus topic" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-13-9) threshold: 0.48`

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/cli/#__codelineno-14-1) crwl https://example.com -f filter_bm25.yml -o markdown-fit`

Output Formats
--------------

*   `all` - Full crawl result including metadata
*   `json` - Extracted structured data (when using extraction)
*   `markdown` / `md` - Raw markdown output
*   `markdown-fit` / `md-fit` - Filtered markdown for better readability

Complete Examples

Best Practices & Tips
---------------------

1.  **Configuration Management**:
2.  Keep common configurations in YAML files
3.  Use CLI parameters for quick overrides
4.  Store sensitive data (API tokens) in `~/.crawl4ai/global.yml`
    
5.  **Performance Optimization**:
    
6.  Use `--bypass-cache` for fresh content
7.  Enable `scan_full_page` for infinite scroll pages
8.  Adjust `delay_before_return_html` for dynamic content
    
9.  **Content Extraction**:
    
10.  Use CSS extraction for structured content
11.  Use LLM extraction for unstructured content
12.  Combine with filters for focused results
    
13.  **Q&A Workflow**:
    
14.  View content first with `-o markdown`
15.  Ask specific questions
16.  Use broader context with appropriate selectors

Recap
-----

The Crawl4AI CLI provides: - Flexible configuration via files and parameters - Multiple extraction strategies (CSS, XPath, LLM) - Content filtering and optimization - Interactive Q&A capabilities - Various output formats

# Crawler Result - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Crawl Result and Output
=======================

When you call `arun()` on a page, Crawl4AI returns a **`CrawlResult`** object containing everything you might need—raw HTML, a cleaned version, optional screenshots or PDFs, structured extraction results, and more. This document explains those fields and how they map to different output types.

* * *

1\. The `CrawlResult` Model
---------------------------

Below is the core schema. Each field captures a different aspect of the crawl’s result:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-1) class MarkdownGenerationResult(BaseModel): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-2)     raw_markdown: str [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-3)     markdown_with_citations: str [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-4)     references_markdown: str [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-5)     fit_markdown: Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-6)     fit_html: Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-8) class CrawlResult(BaseModel): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-9)     url: str [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-10)     html: str [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-11)     success: bool [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-12)     cleaned_html: Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-13)     media: Dict[str, List[Dict]] = {} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-14)     links: Dict[str, List[Dict]] = {} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-15)     downloaded_files: Optional[List[str]] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-16)     screenshot: Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-17)     pdf : Optional[bytes] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-18)     mhtml: Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-19)     markdown: Optional[Union[str, MarkdownGenerationResult]] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-20)     extracted_content: Optional[str] = None Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-23)     session_id: Optional[str] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-24)     response_headers: Optional[dict] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-25)     status_code: Optional[int] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-26)     ssl_certificate: Optional[SSLCertificate] = None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-27)     class Config: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-0-28)         arbitrary_types_allowed = True`

### Table: Key Fields in `CrawlResult`

| Field (Name & Type) | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **url (`str`)** | The final or actual URL crawled (in case of redirects). |
| **html (`str`)** | Original, unmodified page HTML. Good for debugging or custom processing. |
| **success (`bool`)** | `True` if the crawl completed without major errors, else `False`. |
| **cleaned\_html (`Optional[str]`)** | Sanitized HTML with scripts/styles removed; can exclude tags if configured via `excluded_tags` etc. |
| **media (`Dict[str, List[Dict]]`)** | Extracted media info (images, audio, etc.), each with attributes like `src`, `alt`, `score`, etc. |
| **links (`Dict[str, List[Dict]]`)** | Extracted link data, split by `internal` and `external`. Each link usually has `href`, `text`, etc. |
| **downloaded\_files (`Optional[List[str]]`)** | If `accept_downloads=True` in `BrowserConfig`, this lists the filepaths of saved downloads. |
| **screenshot (`Optional[str]`)** | Screenshot of the page (base64-encoded) if `screenshot=True`. |
| **pdf (`Optional[bytes]`)** | PDF of the page if `pdf=True`. |
| **mhtml (`Optional[str]`)** | MHTML snapshot of the page if `capture_mhtml=True`. Contains the full page with all resources. |
| **markdown (`Optional[str or MarkdownGenerationResult]`)** | It holds a `MarkdownGenerationResult`. Over time, this will be consolidated into `markdown`. The generator can provide raw markdown, citations, references, and optionally `fit_markdown`. |
| **extracted\_content (`Optional[str]`)** | The output of a structured extraction (CSS/LLM-based) stored as JSON string or other text. |
| **metadata (`Optional[dict]`)** | Additional info about the crawl or extracted data. |
| **error\_message (`Optional[str]`)** | If `success=False`, contains a short description of what went wrong. |
| **session\_id (`Optional[str]`)** | The ID of the session used for multi-page or persistent crawling. |
| **response\_headers (`Optional[dict]`)** | HTTP response headers, if captured. |
| **status\_code (`Optional[int]`)** | HTTP status code (e.g., 200 for OK). |
| **ssl\_certificate (`Optional[SSLCertificate]`)** | SSL certificate info if `fetch_ssl_certificate=True`. |

* * *

2\. HTML Variants
-----------------

### `html`: Raw HTML

Crawl4AI preserves the exact HTML as `result.html`. Useful for:

*   Debugging page issues or checking the original content.
*   Performing your own specialized parse if needed.

### `cleaned_html`: Sanitized

If you specify any cleanup or exclusion parameters in `CrawlerRunConfig` (like `excluded_tags`, `remove_forms`, etc.), you’ll see the result here:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-1-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-1-2)     excluded_tags=["form", "header", "footer"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-1-3)     keep_data_attributes=False [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-1-4) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-1-5) result = await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-1-6) print(result.cleaned_html)  # Freed of forms, header, footer, data-* attributes`

* * *

3\. Markdown Generation
-----------------------

### 3.1 `markdown`

*   **`markdown`**: The current location for detailed markdown output, returning a **`MarkdownGenerationResult`** object.
*   **`markdown_v2`**: Deprecated since v0.5.

**`MarkdownGenerationResult`** Fields:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **raw\_markdown** | The basic HTML→Markdown conversion. |
| **markdown\_with\_citations** | Markdown including inline citations that reference links at the end. |
| **references\_markdown** | The references/citations themselves (if `citations=True`). |
| **fit\_markdown** | The filtered/“fit” markdown if a content filter was used. |
| **fit\_html** | The filtered HTML that generated `fit_markdown`. |

### 3.2 Basic Example with a Markdown Generator

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-2) from crawl4ai.markdown_generation_strategy import DefaultMarkdownGenerator [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-4) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-5)     markdown_generator=DefaultMarkdownGenerator( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-6)         options={"citations": True, "body_width": 80}  # e.g. pass html2text style options [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-7)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-9) result = await crawler.arun(url="https://example.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-11) md_res = result.markdown  # or eventually 'result.markdown' [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-12) print(md_res.raw_markdown[:500]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-13) print(md_res.markdown_with_citations) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-2-14) print(md_res.references_markdown)`

**Note**: If you use a filter like `PruningContentFilter`, you’ll get `fit_markdown` and `fit_html` as well.

* * *

4\. Structured Extraction: `extracted_content`
----------------------------------------------

If you run a JSON-based extraction strategy (CSS, XPath, LLM, etc.), the structured data is **not** stored in `markdown`—it’s placed in **`result.extracted_content`** as a JSON string (or sometimes plain text).

### Example: CSS Extraction with `raw://` HTML

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-2) import json [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-3) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig, CacheMode [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-4) from crawl4ai import JsonCssExtractionStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-6) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-7)     schema = { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-8)         "name": "Example Items", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-9)         "baseSelector": "div.item", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-10)         "fields": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-11)             {"name": "title", "selector": "h2", "type": "text"}, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-12)             {"name": "link", "selector": "a", "type": "attribute", "attribute": "href"} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-13)         ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-14)     } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-15)     raw_html = "<div class='item'><h2>Item 1</h2><a href='https://example.com/item1'>Link 1</a></div>" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-17)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-18)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-19)             url="raw://" + raw_html, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-20)             config=CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-21)                 cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-22)                 extraction_strategy=JsonCssExtractionStrategy(schema) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-23)             ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-24)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-25)         data = json.loads(result.extracted_content) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-26)         print(data) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-27) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-28) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-3-29)     asyncio.run(main())`

Here: - `url="raw://..."` passes the HTML content directly, no network requests.  
\- The **CSS** extraction strategy populates `result.extracted_content` with the JSON array `[{"title": "...", "link": "..."}]`.

* * *

5\. More Fields: Links, Media, and More
---------------------------------------

### 5.1 `links`

A dictionary, typically with `"internal"` and `"external"` lists. Each entry might have `href`, `text`, `title`, etc. This is automatically captured if you haven’t disabled link extraction.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-4-1) print(result.links["internal"][:3])  # Show first 3 internal links`

### 5.2 `media`

Similarly, a dictionary with `"images"`, `"audio"`, `"video"`, etc. Each item could include `src`, `alt`, `score`, and more, if your crawler is set to gather them.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-5-1) images = result.media.get("images", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-5-2) for img in images: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-5-3)     print("Image URL:", img["src"], "Alt:", img.get("alt"))`

### 5.3 `screenshot`, `pdf`, and `mhtml`

If you set `screenshot=True`, `pdf=True`, or `capture_mhtml=True` in **`CrawlerRunConfig`**, then:

*   `result.screenshot` contains a base64-encoded PNG string.
*   `result.pdf` contains raw PDF bytes (you can write them to a file).
*   `result.mhtml` contains the MHTML snapshot of the page as a string (you can write it to a .mhtml file).

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-1) # Save the PDF [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-2) with open("page.pdf", "wb") as f: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-3)     f.write(result.pdf) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-5) # Save the MHTML [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-6) if result.mhtml: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-7)     with open("page.mhtml", "w", encoding="utf-8") as f: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-6-8)         f.write(result.mhtml)`

The MHTML (MIME HTML) format is particularly useful as it captures the entire web page including all of its resources (CSS, images, scripts, etc.) in a single file, making it perfect for archiving or offline viewing.

### 5.4 `ssl_certificate`

If `fetch_ssl_certificate=True`, `result.ssl_certificate` holds details about the site’s SSL cert, such as issuer, validity dates, etc.

* * *

6\. Accessing These Fields
--------------------------

After you run:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-7-1) result = await crawler.arun(url="https://example.com", config=some_config)`

Check any field:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-1) if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-2)     print(result.status_code, result.response_headers) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-3)     print("Links found:", len(result.links.get("internal", []))) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-4)     if result.markdown: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-5)         print("Markdown snippet:", result.markdown.raw_markdown[:200]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-6)     if result.extracted_content: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-7)         print("Structured JSON:", result.extracted_content) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-8) else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/crawler-result/#__codelineno-8-9)     print("Error:", result.error_message)`

**Deprecation**: Since v0.5 `result.markdown_v2`, `result.fit_html`,`result.fit_markdown` are deprecated. Use `result.markdown` instead! It holds `MarkdownGenerationResult`, which includes `fit_html` and `fit_markdown` as it's properties.

# Virtual Scroll - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Virtual Scroll
==============

Modern websites increasingly use **virtual scrolling** (also called windowed rendering or viewport rendering) to handle large datasets efficiently. This technique only renders visible items in the DOM, replacing content as users scroll. Popular examples include Twitter's timeline, Instagram's feed, and many data tables.

Crawl4AI's Virtual Scroll feature automatically detects and handles these scenarios, ensuring you capture **all content**, not just what's initially visible.

Understanding Virtual Scroll
----------------------------

### The Problem

Traditional infinite scroll **appends** new content to existing content. Virtual scroll **replaces** content to maintain performance:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-1) Traditional Scroll:          Virtual Scroll: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-2) ┌─────────────┐             ┌─────────────┐ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-3) │ Item 1      │             │ Item 11     │  <- Items 1-10 removed [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-4) │ Item 2      │             │ Item 12     │  <- Only visible items [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-5) │ ...         │             │ Item 13     │     in DOM [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-6) │ Item 10     │             │ Item 14     │ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-7) │ Item 11 NEW │             │ Item 15     │ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-8) │ Item 12 NEW │             └─────────────┘ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-9) └─────────────┘              [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-0-10) DOM keeps growing           DOM size stays constant`

Without proper handling, crawlers only capture the currently visible items, missing the rest of the content.

### Three Scrolling Scenarios

Crawl4AI's Virtual Scroll detects and handles three scenarios:

1.  **No Change** - Content doesn't update on scroll (static page or end reached)
2.  **Content Appended** - New items added to existing ones (traditional infinite scroll)
3.  **Content Replaced** - Items replaced with new ones (true virtual scroll)

Only scenario 3 requires special handling, which Virtual Scroll automates.

Basic Usage
-----------

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig, VirtualScrollConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-3) # Configure virtual scroll [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-4) virtual_config = VirtualScrollConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-5)     container_selector="#feed",      # CSS selector for scrollable container [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-6)     scroll_count=20,                 # Number of scrolls to perform [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-7)     scroll_by="container_height",    # How much to scroll each time [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-8)     wait_after_scroll=0.5           # Wait time (seconds) after each scroll [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-9) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-11) # Use in crawler configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-12) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-13)     virtual_scroll_config=virtual_config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-14) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-16) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-17)     result = await crawler.arun(url="https://example.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-1-18)     # result.html contains ALL items from the virtual scroll`

Configuration Parameters
------------------------

### VirtualScrollConfig

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `container_selector` | `str` | Required | CSS selector for the scrollable container |
| `scroll_count` | `int` | `10` | Maximum number of scrolls to perform |
| `scroll_by` | `str` or `int` | `"container_height"` | Scroll amount per step |
| `wait_after_scroll` | `float` | `0.5` | Seconds to wait after each scroll |

### Scroll By Options

*   `"container_height"` - Scroll by the container's visible height
*   `"page_height"` - Scroll by the viewport height
*   `500` (integer) - Scroll by exact pixel amount

Real-World Examples
-------------------

### Twitter-like Timeline

Featured articles remain throughout [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-4-21)         featured = result.html.count('class="featured-article"') [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-4-22)         regular = result.html.count('class="regular-article"') [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-4-23) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-4-24)         print(f"Featured (static): {featured}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-4-25)         print(f"Regular (virtualized): {regular}")`

Virtual Scroll vs scan\_full\_page
----------------------------------

Both features handle dynamic content, but serve different purposes:

| Feature | Virtual Scroll | scan\_full\_page |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Purpose** | Capture content that's replaced during scroll | Load content that's appended during scroll |
| **Use Case** | Twitter, Instagram, virtual tables | Traditional infinite scroll, lazy-loaded images |
| **DOM Behavior** | Replaces elements | Adds elements |
| **Memory Usage** | Efficient (merges content) | Can grow large |
| **Configuration** | Requires container selector | Works on full page |

### When to Use Which?

Use **Virtual Scroll** when: - Content disappears as you scroll (Twitter timeline) - DOM element count stays relatively constant - You need ALL items from a virtualized list - Container-based scrolling (not full page)

Use **scan\_full\_page** when: - Content accumulates as you scroll - Images load lazily - Simple "load more" behavior - Full page scrolling

Combining with Extraction
-------------------------

Virtual Scroll works seamlessly with extraction strategies:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-1) from crawl4ai import LLMExtractionStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-3) # Define extraction schema [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-4) schema = { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-5)     "type": "array", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-6)     "items": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-7)         "type": "object",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-8)         "properties": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-9)             "author": {"type": "string"}, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-10)             "content": {"type": "string"}, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-11)             "timestamp": {"type": "string"} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-12)         } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-13)     } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-14) } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-16) # Configure both virtual scroll and extraction [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-17) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-18)     virtual_scroll_config=VirtualScrollConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-19)         container_selector="#timeline", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-20)         scroll_count=20 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-21)     ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-22)     extraction_strategy=LLMExtractionStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-23)         provider="openai/gpt-4o-mini", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-24)         schema=schema [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-25)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-26) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-27) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-28) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-29)     result = await crawler.arun(url="...", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-30) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-31)     # Extracted data from ALL scrolled content [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-32)     import json [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-33)     posts = json.loads(result.extracted_content) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-5-34)     print(f"Extracted {len(posts)} posts from virtual scroll")`

Performance Tips
----------------

1.  **Container Selection**: Be specific with selectors. Using the correct container improves performance.
    
2.  **Scroll Count**: Start conservative and increase as needed:
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-6-1) # Start with fewer scrolls [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-6-2) virtual_config = VirtualScrollConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-6-3)     container_selector="#feed", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-6-4)     scroll_count=10  # Test with 10, increase if needed [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-6-5) )`
    
3.  **Wait Times**: Adjust based on site speed:
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-7-1) # Fast sites [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-7-2) wait_after_scroll=0.2 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-7-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-7-4) # Slower sites or heavy content [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-7-5) wait_after_scroll=1.5`
    
4.  **Debug Mode**: Set `headless=False` to watch scrolling:
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-8-1) browser_config = BrowserConfig(headless=False) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-8-2) async with AsyncWebCrawler(config=browser_config) as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-8-3)     # Watch the scrolling happen`
    

How It Works Internally
-----------------------

1.  **Detection Phase**: Scrolls and compares HTML to detect behavior
2.  **Capture Phase**: For replaced content, stores HTML chunks at each position
3.  **Merge Phase**: Combines all chunks, removing duplicates based on text content
4.  **Result**: Complete HTML with all unique items

The deduplication uses normalized text (lowercase, no spaces/symbols) to ensure accurate merging without false positives.

Error Handling
--------------

Virtual Scroll handles errors gracefully:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-1) # If container not found or scrolling fails [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-2) result = await crawler.arun(url="...", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-4) if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-5)     # Virtual scroll worked or wasn't needed [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-6)     print(f"Captured {len(result.html)} characters") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-7) else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-8)     # Crawl failed entirely [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-9-9)     print(f"Error: {result.error_message}")`

If the container isn't found, crawling continues normally without virtual scroll.

Complete Example
----------------

See our [comprehensive example](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/docs/examples/virtual_scroll_example.py)
 that demonstrates: - Twitter-like feeds - Instagram grids  
\- Traditional infinite scroll - Mixed content scenarios - Performance comparisons

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-10-1) # Run the examples [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-10-2) cd docs/examples [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/#__codelineno-10-3) python virtual_scroll_example.py`

The example includes a local test server with different scrolling behaviors for experimentation.

# Adaptive Crawling - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Adaptive Web Crawling
=====================

Introduction
------------

Traditional web crawlers follow predetermined patterns, crawling pages blindly without knowing when they've gathered enough information. **Adaptive Crawling** changes this paradigm by introducing intelligence into the crawling process.

Think of it like research: when you're looking for information, you don't read every book in the library. You stop when you've found sufficient information to answer your question. That's exactly what Adaptive Crawling does for web scraping.

Key Concepts
------------

### The Problem It Solves

When crawling websites for specific information, you face two challenges: 1. **Under-crawling**: Stopping too early and missing crucial information 2. **Over-crawling**: Wasting resources by crawling irrelevant pages

Adaptive Crawling solves both by using a three-layer scoring system that determines when you have "enough" information.

### How It Works

The AdaptiveCrawler uses three metrics to measure information sufficiency:

*   **Coverage**: How well your collected pages cover the query terms
*   **Consistency**: Whether the information is coherent across pages
*   **Saturation**: Detecting when new pages aren't adding new information

When these metrics indicate sufficient information has been gathered, crawling stops automatically.

Quick Start
-----------

### Basic Usage

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, AdaptiveCrawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-3) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-4)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-5)         # Create an adaptive crawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-6)         adaptive = AdaptiveCrawler(crawler) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-8)         # Start crawling with a query [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-9)         result = await adaptive.digest( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-10)             start_url="https://docs.python.org/3/", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-11)             query="async context managers" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-12)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-13) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-14)         # View statistics [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-15)         adaptive.print_stats() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-17)         # Get the most relevant content [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-18)         relevant_pages = adaptive.get_relevant_content(top_k=5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-19)         for page in relevant_pages: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-0-20)             print(f"- {page['url']} (score: {page['score']:.2f})")`

### Configuration Options

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-1) from crawl4ai import AdaptiveConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-3) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-4)     confidence_threshold=0.7,    # Stop when 70% confident (default: 0.8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-5)     max_pages=20,               # Maximum pages to crawl (default: 50) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-6)     top_k_links=3,              # Links to follow per page (default: 5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-7)     min_gain_threshold=0.05     # Minimum expected gain to continue (default: 0.1) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-1-10) adaptive = AdaptiveCrawler(crawler, config=config)`

Crawling Strategies
-------------------

Adaptive Crawling supports two distinct strategies for determining information sufficiency:

### Statistical Strategy (Default)

The statistical strategy uses pure information theory and term-based analysis:

*   **Fast and efficient** - No API calls or model loading
*   **Term-based coverage** - Analyzes query term presence and distribution
*   **No external dependencies** - Works offline
*   **Best for**: Well-defined queries with specific terminology

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-2-1) # Default configuration uses statistical strategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-2-2) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-2-3)     strategy="statistical",  # This is the default [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-2-4)     confidence_threshold=0.8 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-2-5) )`

### Embedding Strategy

The embedding strategy uses semantic embeddings for deeper understanding:

*   **Semantic understanding** - Captures meaning beyond exact term matches
*   **Query expansion** - Automatically generates query variations
*   **Gap-driven selection** - Identifies semantic gaps in knowledge
*   **Validation-based stopping** - Uses held-out queries to validate coverage
*   **Best for**: Complex queries, ambiguous topics, conceptual understanding

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-1) # Configure embedding strategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-2) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-3)     strategy="embedding", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-4)     embedding_model="sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2",  # Default [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-5)     n_query_variations=10,  # Generate 10 query variations [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-6)     embedding_min_confidence_threshold=0.1  # Stop if completely irrelevant [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-7) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-9) # With custom embedding provider (e.g., OpenAI) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-10) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-11)     strategy="embedding", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-12)     embedding_llm_config={ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-13)         'provider': 'openai/text-embedding-3-small', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-14)         'api_token': 'your-api-key' [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-15)     } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-3-16) )`

### Strategy Comparison

| Feature | Statistical | Embedding |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Speed** | Very fast | Moderate (API calls) |
| **Cost** | Free | Depends on provider |
| **Accuracy** | Good for exact terms | Excellent for concepts |
| **Dependencies** | None | Embedding model/API |
| **Query Understanding** | Literal | Semantic |
| **Best Use Case** | Technical docs, specific terms | Research, broad topics |

### Embedding Strategy Configuration

The embedding strategy offers fine-tuned control through several parameters:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-1) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-2)     strategy="embedding", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-4)     # Model configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-5)     embedding_model="sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-6)     embedding_llm_config=None,  # Use for API-based embeddings [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-8)     # Query expansion [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-9)     n_query_variations=10,  # Number of query variations to generate [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-11)     # Coverage parameters [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-12)     embedding_coverage_radius=0.2,  # Distance threshold for coverage [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-13)     embedding_k_exp=3.0,  # Exponential decay factor (higher = stricter) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-14) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-15)     # Stopping criteria [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-16)     embedding_min_relative_improvement=0.1,  # Min improvement to continue [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-17)     embedding_validation_min_score=0.3,  # Min validation score [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-18)     embedding_min_confidence_threshold=0.1,  # Below this = irrelevant [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-19) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-20)     # Link selection [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-21)     embedding_overlap_threshold=0.85,  # Similarity for deduplication [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-22) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-23)     # Display confidence mapping [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-24)     embedding_quality_min_confidence=0.7,  # Min displayed confidence [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-25)     embedding_quality_max_confidence=0.95  # Max displayed confidence [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-4-26) )`

### Handling Irrelevant Queries

The embedding strategy can detect when a query is completely unrelated to the content:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-1) # This will stop quickly with low confidence [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-2) result = await adaptive.digest( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-3)     start_url="https://docs.python.org/3/", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-4)     query="how to cook pasta"  # Irrelevant to Python docs [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-7) # Check if query was irrelevant [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-8) if result.metrics.get('is_irrelevant', False): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-5-9)     print("Query is unrelated to the content!")`

When to Use Adaptive Crawling
-----------------------------

### Perfect For:

*   **Research Tasks**: Finding comprehensive information about a topic
*   **Question Answering**: Gathering sufficient context to answer specific queries
*   **Knowledge Base Building**: Creating focused datasets for AI/ML applications
*   **Competitive Intelligence**: Collecting complete information about specific products/features

### Not Recommended For:

*   **Full Site Archiving**: When you need every page regardless of content
*   **Structured Data Extraction**: When targeting specific, known page patterns
*   **Real-time Monitoring**: When you need continuous updates

Understanding the Output
------------------------

### Confidence Score

The confidence score (0-1) indicates how sufficient the gathered information is: - **0.0-0.3**: Insufficient information, needs more crawling - **0.3-0.6**: Partial information, may answer basic queries - **0.6-0.8**: Good coverage, can answer most queries - **0.8-1.0**: Excellent coverage, comprehensive information

### Statistics Display

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-6-1) adaptive.print_stats(detailed=False)  # Summary table [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-6-2) adaptive.print_stats(detailed=True)   # Detailed metrics`

The summary shows: - Pages crawled vs. confidence achieved - Coverage, consistency, and saturation scores - Crawling efficiency metrics

Persistence and Resumption
--------------------------

### Saving Progress

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-1) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-2)     save_state=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-3)     state_path="my_crawl_state.json" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-4) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-6) # Crawl will auto-save progress [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-7-7) result = await adaptive.digest(start_url, query)`

### Resuming a Crawl

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-8-1) # Resume from saved state [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-8-2) result = await adaptive.digest( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-8-3)     start_url, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-8-4)     query, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-8-5)     resume_from="my_crawl_state.json" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-8-6) )`

### Exporting Knowledge Base

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-9-1) # Export collected pages to JSONL [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-9-2) adaptive.export_knowledge_base("knowledge_base.jsonl") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-9-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-9-4) # Import into another session [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-9-5) new_adaptive = AdaptiveCrawler(crawler) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-9-6) new_adaptive.import_knowledge_base("knowledge_base.jsonl")`

Best Practices
--------------

### 1\. Query Formulation

*   Use specific, descriptive queries
*   Include key terms you expect to find
*   Avoid overly broad queries

### 2\. Threshold Tuning

*   Start with default (0.8) for general use
*   Lower to 0.6-0.7 for exploratory crawling
*   Raise to 0.9+ for exhaustive coverage

### 3\. Performance Optimization

*   Use appropriate `max_pages` limits
*   Adjust `top_k_links` based on site structure
*   Enable caching for repeat crawls

### 4\. Link Selection

*   The crawler prioritizes links based on:
*   Relevance to query
*   Expected information gain
*   URL structure and depth

Examples
--------

### Research Assistant

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-1) # Gather information about a programming concept [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-2) result = await adaptive.digest( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-3)     start_url="https://realpython.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-4)     query="python decorators implementation patterns" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-7) # Get the most relevant excerpts [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-8) for doc in adaptive.get_relevant_content(top_k=3): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-9)     print(f"\nFrom: {doc['url']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-10)     print(f"Relevance: {doc['score']:.2%}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-10-11)     print(doc['content'][:500] + "...")`

### Knowledge Base Builder

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-1) # Build a focused knowledge base about machine learning [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-2) queries = [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-3)     "supervised learning algorithms", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-4)     "neural network architectures",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-5)     "model evaluation metrics" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-6) ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-8) for query in queries: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-9)     await adaptive.digest( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-10)         start_url="https://scikit-learn.org/stable/", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-11)         query=query [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-12)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-13) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-14) # Export combined knowledge base [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-11-15) adaptive.export_knowledge_base("ml_knowledge.jsonl")`

### API Documentation Crawler

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-1) # Intelligently crawl API documentation [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-2) config = AdaptiveConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-3)     confidence_threshold=0.85,  # Higher threshold for completeness [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-4)     max_pages=30 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-7) adaptive = AdaptiveCrawler(crawler, config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-8) result = await adaptive.digest( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-9)     start_url="https://api.example.com/docs", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-10)     query="authentication endpoints rate limits" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/adaptive-crawling/#__codelineno-12-11) )`

FAQ
---

**Q: How is this different from traditional crawling?** A: Traditional crawling follows fixed patterns (BFS/DFS). Adaptive crawling makes intelligent decisions about which links to follow and when to stop based on information gain.

**Q: Can I use this with JavaScript-heavy sites?** A: Yes! AdaptiveCrawler inherits all capabilities from AsyncWebCrawler, including JavaScript execution.

**Q: How does it handle large websites?** A: The algorithm naturally limits crawling to relevant sections. Use `max_pages` as a safety limit.

**Q: Can I customize the scoring algorithms?** A: Advanced users can implement custom strategies. See [Adaptive Strategies](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/adaptive-strategies/)
.
