# Deep Crawling - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Deep Crawling
=============

One of Crawl4AI's most powerful features is its ability to perform **configurable deep crawling** that can explore websites beyond a single page. With fine-tuned control over crawl depth, domain boundaries, and content filtering, Crawl4AI gives you the tools to extract precisely the content you need.

In this tutorial, you'll learn:

1.  How to set up a **Basic Deep Crawler** with BFS strategy
2.  Understanding the difference between **streamed and non-streamed** output
3.  Implementing **filters and scorers** to target specific content
4.  Creating **advanced filtering chains** for sophisticated crawls
5.  Using **BestFirstCrawling** for intelligent exploration prioritization

> **Prerequisites**  
> \- You’ve completed or read [AsyncWebCrawler Basics](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/)
>  to understand how to run a simple crawl.  
> \- You know how to configure `CrawlerRunConfig`.

* * *

1\. Quick Example
-----------------

Here's a minimal code snippet that implements a basic deep crawl using the **BFSDeepCrawlStrategy**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-3) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import BFSDeepCrawlStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-4) from crawl4ai.content_scraping_strategy import LXMLWebScrapingStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-6) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-7)     # Configure a 2-level deep crawl [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-8)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-9)         deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-10)             max_depth=2,  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-11)             include_external=False [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-12)         ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-13)         scraping_strategy=LXMLWebScrapingStrategy(), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-14)         verbose=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-15)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-17)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-18)         results = await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-19) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-20)         print(f"Crawled {len(results)} pages in total") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-21) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-22)         # Access individual results [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-23)         for result in results[:3]:  # Show first 3 results [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-24)             print(f"URL: {result.url}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-25)             print(f"Depth: {result.metadata.get('depth', 0)}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-26) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-27) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-0-28)     asyncio.run(main())`

**What's happening?**  
\- `BFSDeepCrawlStrategy(max_depth=2, include_external=False)` instructs Crawl4AI to: - Crawl the starting page (depth 0) plus 2 more levels - Stay within the same domain (don't follow external links) - Each result contains metadata like the crawl depth - Results are returned as a list after all crawling is complete

* * *

2\. Understanding Deep Crawling Strategy Options
------------------------------------------------

### 2.1 BFSDeepCrawlStrategy (Breadth-First Search)

The **BFSDeepCrawlStrategy** uses a breadth-first approach, exploring all links at one depth before moving deeper:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import BFSDeepCrawlStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-3) # Basic configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-4) strategy = BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-5)     max_depth=2,               # Crawl initial page + 2 levels deep [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-6)     include_external=False,    # Stay within the same domain [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-7)     max_pages=50,              # Maximum number of pages to crawl (optional) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-8)     score_threshold=0.3,       # Minimum score for URLs to be crawled (optional) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-1-9) )`

**Key parameters:** - **`max_depth`**: Number of levels to crawl beyond the starting page - **`include_external`**: Whether to follow links to other domains - **`max_pages`**: Maximum number of pages to crawl (default: infinite) - **`score_threshold`**: Minimum score for URLs to be crawled (default: -inf) - **`filter_chain`**: FilterChain instance for URL filtering - **`url_scorer`**: Scorer instance for evaluating URLs

### 2.2 DFSDeepCrawlStrategy (Depth-First Search)

The **DFSDeepCrawlStrategy** uses a depth-first approach, explores as far down a branch as possible before backtracking.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import DFSDeepCrawlStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-3) # Basic configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-4) strategy = DFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-5)     max_depth=2,               # Crawl initial page + 2 levels deep [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-6)     include_external=False,    # Stay within the same domain [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-7)     max_pages=30,              # Maximum number of pages to crawl (optional) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-8)     score_threshold=0.5,       # Minimum score for URLs to be crawled (optional) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-2-9) )`

**Key parameters:** - **`max_depth`**: Number of levels to crawl beyond the starting page - **`include_external`**: Whether to follow links to other domains - **`max_pages`**: Maximum number of pages to crawl (default: infinite) - **`score_threshold`**: Minimum score for URLs to be crawled (default: -inf) - **`filter_chain`**: FilterChain instance for URL filtering - **`url_scorer`**: Scorer instance for evaluating URLs

### 2.3 BestFirstCrawlingStrategy (⭐️ - Recommended Deep crawl strategy)

For more intelligent crawling, use **BestFirstCrawlingStrategy** with scorers to prioritize the most relevant pages:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import BestFirstCrawlingStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-2) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.scorers import KeywordRelevanceScorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-4) # Create a scorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-5) scorer = KeywordRelevanceScorer( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-6)     keywords=["crawl", "example", "async", "configuration"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-7)     weight=0.7 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-10) # Configure the strategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-11) strategy = BestFirstCrawlingStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-12)     max_depth=2, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-13)     include_external=False, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-14)     url_scorer=scorer, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-15)     max_pages=25,              # Maximum number of pages to crawl (optional) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-3-16) )`

This crawling approach: - Evaluates each discovered URL based on scorer criteria - Visits higher-scoring pages first - Helps focus crawl resources on the most relevant content - Can limit total pages crawled with `max_pages` - Does not need `score_threshold` as it naturally prioritizes by score

* * *

3\. Streaming vs. Non-Streaming Results
---------------------------------------

Crawl4AI can return results in two modes:

### 3.1 Non-Streaming Mode (Default)

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-2)     deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy(max_depth=1), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-3)     stream=False  # Default behavior [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-4) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-6) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-7)     # Wait for ALL results to be collected before returning [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-8)     results = await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-10)     for result in results: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-4-11)         process_result(result)`

**When to use non-streaming mode:** - You need the complete dataset before processing - You're performing batch operations on all results together - Crawl time isn't a critical factor

### 3.2 Streaming Mode

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-2)     deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy(max_depth=1), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-3)     stream=True  # Enable streaming [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-4) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-6) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-7)     # Returns an async iterator [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-8)     async for result in await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=config): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-9)         # Process each result as it becomes available [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-5-10)         process_result(result)`

**Benefits of streaming mode:** - Process results immediately as they're discovered - Start working with early results while crawling continues - Better for real-time applications or progressive display - Reduces memory pressure when handling many pages

* * *

4\. Filtering Content with Filter Chains
----------------------------------------

Filters help you narrow down which pages to crawl. Combine multiple filters using **FilterChain** for powerful targeting.

### 4.1 Basic URL Pattern Filter

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.filters import FilterChain, URLPatternFilter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-3) # Only follow URLs containing "blog" or "docs" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-4) url_filter = URLPatternFilter(patterns=["*blog*", "*docs*"]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-6) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-7)     deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-8)         max_depth=1, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-9)         filter_chain=FilterChain([url_filter]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-10)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-6-11) )`

### 4.2 Combining Multiple Filters

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.filters import ( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-2)     FilterChain, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-3)     URLPatternFilter, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-4)     DomainFilter, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-5)     ContentTypeFilter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-6) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-8) # Create a chain of filters [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-9) filter_chain = FilterChain([ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-10)     # Only follow URLs with specific patterns [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-11)     URLPatternFilter(patterns=["*guide*", "*tutorial*"]), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-13)     # Only crawl specific domains [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-14)     DomainFilter( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-15)         allowed_domains=["docs.example.com"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-16)         blocked_domains=["old.docs.example.com"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-17)     ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-18) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-19)     # Only include specific content types [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-20)     ContentTypeFilter(allowed_types=["text/html"]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-21) ]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-22) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-23) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-24)     deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-25)         max_depth=2, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-26)         filter_chain=filter_chain [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-27)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-7-28) )`

### 4.3 Available Filter Types

Crawl4AI includes several specialized filters:

*   **`URLPatternFilter`**: Matches URL patterns using wildcard syntax
*   **`DomainFilter`**: Controls which domains to include or exclude
*   **`ContentTypeFilter`**: Filters based on HTTP Content-Type
*   **`ContentRelevanceFilter`**: Uses similarity to a text query
*   **`SEOFilter`**: Evaluates SEO elements (meta tags, headers, etc.)

* * *

5\. Using Scorers for Prioritized Crawling
------------------------------------------

Scorers assign priority values to discovered URLs, helping the crawler focus on the most relevant content first.

### 5.1 KeywordRelevanceScorer

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.scorers import KeywordRelevanceScorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-2) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import BestFirstCrawlingStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-4) # Create a keyword relevance scorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-5) keyword_scorer = KeywordRelevanceScorer( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-6)     keywords=["crawl", "example", "async", "configuration"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-7)     weight=0.7  # Importance of this scorer (0.0 to 1.0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-10) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-11)     deep_crawl_strategy=BestFirstCrawlingStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-12)         max_depth=2, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-13)         url_scorer=keyword_scorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-14)     ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-15)     stream=True  # Recommended with BestFirstCrawling [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-16) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-18) # Results will come in order of relevance score [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-19) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-20)     async for result in await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=config): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-21)         score = result.metadata.get("score", 0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-8-22)         print(f"Score: {score:.2f} | {result.url}")`

**How scorers work:** - Evaluate each discovered URL before crawling - Calculate relevance based on various signals - Help the crawler make intelligent choices about traversal order

* * *

6\. Advanced Filtering Techniques
---------------------------------

### 6.1 SEO Filter for Quality Assessment

The **SEOFilter** helps you identify pages with strong SEO characteristics:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.filters import FilterChain, SEOFilter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-3) # Create an SEO filter that looks for specific keywords in page metadata [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-4) seo_filter = SEOFilter( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-5)     threshold=0.5,  # Minimum score (0.0 to 1.0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-6)     keywords=["tutorial", "guide", "documentation"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-7) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-9) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-10)     deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-11)         max_depth=1, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-12)         filter_chain=FilterChain([seo_filter]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-13)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-9-14) )`

### 6.2 Content Relevance Filter

The **ContentRelevanceFilter** analyzes the actual content of pages:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-1) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.filters import FilterChain, ContentRelevanceFilter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-3) # Create a content relevance filter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-4) relevance_filter = ContentRelevanceFilter( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-5)     query="Web crawling and data extraction with Python", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-6)     threshold=0.7  # Minimum similarity score (0.0 to 1.0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-7) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-9) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-10)     deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-11)         max_depth=1, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-12)         filter_chain=FilterChain([relevance_filter]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-13)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-10-14) )`

This filter: - Measures semantic similarity between query and page content - It's a BM25-based relevance filter using head section content

* * *

7\. Building a Complete Advanced Crawler
----------------------------------------

This example combines multiple techniques for a sophisticated crawl:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-3) from crawl4ai.content_scraping_strategy import LXMLWebScrapingStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-4) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import BestFirstCrawlingStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-5) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.filters import ( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-6)     FilterChain, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-7)     DomainFilter, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-8)     URLPatternFilter, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-9)     ContentTypeFilter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-10) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-11) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling.scorers import KeywordRelevanceScorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-13) async def run_advanced_crawler(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-14)     # Create a sophisticated filter chain [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-15)     filter_chain = FilterChain([ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-16)         # Domain boundaries [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-17)         DomainFilter( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-18)             allowed_domains=["docs.example.com"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-19)             blocked_domains=["old.docs.example.com"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-20)         ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-21) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-22)         # URL patterns to include [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-23)         URLPatternFilter(patterns=["*guide*", "*tutorial*", "*blog*"]), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-24) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-25)         # Content type filtering [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-26)         ContentTypeFilter(allowed_types=["text/html"]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-27)     ]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-28) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-29)     # Create a relevance scorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-30)     keyword_scorer = KeywordRelevanceScorer( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-31)         keywords=["crawl", "example", "async", "configuration"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-32)         weight=0.7 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-33)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-34) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-35)     # Set up the configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-36)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-37)         deep_crawl_strategy=BestFirstCrawlingStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-38)             max_depth=2, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-39)             include_external=False, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-40)             filter_chain=filter_chain, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-41)             url_scorer=keyword_scorer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-42)         ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-43)         scraping_strategy=LXMLWebScrapingStrategy(), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-44)         stream=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-45)         verbose=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-46)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-47) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-48)     # Execute the crawl [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-49)     results = [] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-50)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-51)         async for result in await crawler.arun("https://docs.example.com", config=config): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-52)             results.append(result) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-53)             score = result.metadata.get("score", 0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-54)             depth = result.metadata.get("depth", 0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-55)             print(f"Depth: {depth} | Score: {score:.2f} | {result.url}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-56) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-57)     # Analyze the results [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-58)     print(f"Crawled {len(results)} high-value pages") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-59)     print(f"Average score: {sum(r.metadata.get('score', 0) for r in results) / len(results):.2f}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-60) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-61)     # Group by depth [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-62)     depth_counts = {} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-63)     for result in results: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-64)         depth = result.metadata.get("depth", 0) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-65)         depth_counts[depth] = depth_counts.get(depth, 0) + 1 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-66) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-67)     print("Pages crawled by depth:") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-68)     for depth, count in sorted(depth_counts.items()): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-69)         print(f"  Depth {depth}: {count} pages") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-70) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-71) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-11-72)     asyncio.run(run_advanced_crawler())`

* * *

8\. Limiting and Controlling Crawl Size
---------------------------------------

### 8.1 Using max\_pages

You can limit the total number of pages crawled with the `max_pages` parameter:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-12-1) # Limit to exactly 20 pages regardless of depth [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-12-2) strategy = BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-12-3)     max_depth=3, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-12-4)     max_pages=20 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-12-5) )`

This feature is useful for: - Controlling API costs - Setting predictable execution times - Focusing on the most important content - Testing crawl configurations before full execution

### 8.2 Using score\_threshold

For BFS and DFS strategies, you can set a minimum score threshold to only crawl high-quality pages:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-13-1) # Only follow links with scores above 0.4 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-13-2) strategy = DFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-13-3)     max_depth=2, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-13-4)     url_scorer=KeywordRelevanceScorer(keywords=["api", "guide", "reference"]), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-13-5)     score_threshold=0.4  # Skip URLs with scores below this value [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/deep-crawling/#__codelineno-13-6) )`

Note that for BestFirstCrawlingStrategy, score\_threshold is not needed since pages are already processed in order of highest score first.

9\. Common Pitfalls & Tips
--------------------------

1.**Set realistic limits.** Be cautious with `max_depth` values > 3, which can exponentially increase crawl size. Use `max_pages` to set hard limits.

2.**Don't neglect the scoring component.** BestFirstCrawling works best with well-tuned scorers. Experiment with keyword weights for optimal prioritization.

3.**Be a good web citizen.** Respect robots.txt. (disabled by default)

4.**Handle page errors gracefully.** Not all pages will be accessible. Check `result.status` when processing results.

5.**Balance breadth vs. depth.** Choose your strategy wisely - BFS for comprehensive coverage, DFS for deep exploration, BestFirst for focused relevance-based crawling.

* * *

10\. Summary & Next Steps
-------------------------

In this **Deep Crawling with Crawl4AI** tutorial, you learned to:

*   Configure **BFSDeepCrawlStrategy**, **DFSDeepCrawlStrategy**, and **BestFirstCrawlingStrategy**
*   Process results in streaming or non-streaming mode
*   Apply filters to target specific content
*   Use scorers to prioritize the most relevant pages
*   Limit crawls with `max_pages` and `score_threshold` parameters
*   Build a complete advanced crawler with combined techniques

With these tools, you can efficiently extract structured data from websites at scale, focusing precisely on the content you need for your specific use case.

* * *

Running the Examples

# 🚀 Crawl4AI v0.7.0: The Adaptive Intelligence Update - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

🚀 Crawl4AI v0.7.0: The Adaptive Intelligence Update
====================================================

_January 28, 2025 • 10 min read_

* * *

Today I'm releasing Crawl4AI v0.7.0—the Adaptive Intelligence Update. This release introduces fundamental improvements in how Crawl4AI handles modern web complexity through adaptive learning, intelligent content discovery, and advanced extraction capabilities.

🎯 What's New at a Glance
-------------------------

*   **Adaptive Crawling**: Your crawler now learns and adapts to website patterns
*   **Virtual Scroll Support**: Complete content extraction from infinite scroll pages
*   **Link Preview with 3-Layer Scoring**: Intelligent link analysis and prioritization
*   **Async URL Seeder**: Discover thousands of URLs in seconds with intelligent filtering
*   **PDF Parsing**: Extract data from PDF documents
*   **Performance Optimizations**: Significant speed and memory improvements

🧠 Adaptive Crawling: Intelligence Through Pattern Learning
-----------------------------------------------------------

**The Problem:** Websites change. Class names shift. IDs disappear. Your carefully crafted selectors break at 3 AM, and you wake up to empty datasets and angry stakeholders.

**My Solution:** I implemented an adaptive learning system that observes patterns, builds confidence scores, and adjusts extraction strategies on the fly. It's like having a junior developer who gets better at their job with every page they scrape.

### Technical Deep-Dive

The Adaptive Crawler maintains a persistent state for each domain, tracking: - Pattern success rates - Selector stability over time  
\- Content structure variations - Extraction confidence scores

🌊 Virtual Scroll: Complete Content Capture
-------------------------------------------

**The Problem:** Modern web apps only render what's visible. Scroll down, new content appears, old content vanishes into the void. Traditional crawlers capture that first viewport and miss 90% of the content. It's like reading only the first page of every book.

**My Solution:** I built Virtual Scroll support that mimics human browsing behavior, capturing content as it loads and preserving it before the browser's garbage collector strikes.

### Implementation Details

**Key Capabilities:** - **DOM Recycling Awareness**: Detects and handles virtual DOM element recycling - **Smart Scroll Physics**: Three modes - container height, page height, or fixed pixels - **Content Preservation**: Captures content before it's destroyed - **Intelligent Stopping**: Stops when no new content appears - **Memory Efficient**: Streams content instead of holding everything in memory

**Expected Real-World Impact:** - **Social Media Analysis**: Capture entire Twitter threads with hundreds of replies, not just top 10 - **E-commerce Scraping**: Extract 500+ products from infinite scroll catalogs vs. 20-50 with traditional methods  
\- **News Aggregation**: Get all articles from modern news sites, not just above-the-fold content - **Research Applications**: Complete data extraction from academic databases using virtual pagination

🔗 Link Preview: Intelligent Link Analysis and Scoring
------------------------------------------------------

**The Problem:** You crawl a page and get 200 links. Which ones matter? Which lead to the content you actually want? Traditional crawlers force you to follow everything or build complex filters.

**My Solution:** I implemented a three-layer scoring system that analyzes links like a human would—considering their position, context, and relevance to your goals.

### The Three-Layer Scoring System

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-1) from crawl4ai import LinkPreviewConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-3) # Position, attributes [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-39)     print(f"  Contextual: {link['contextual_score']:.1f}/1")  # Relevance to query [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-40)     print(f"  URL: {link['href']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-41)     print(f"  Title: {link['head_data']['title']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-2-42)     print(f"  Description: {link['head_data']['meta']['description'][:100]}...")`

**Scoring Components:**

1.  **Intrinsic Score (0-10)**: Based on link quality indicators
2.  Position on page (navigation, content, footer)
3.  Link attributes (rel, title, class names)
4.  Anchor text quality and length
5.  URL structure and depth
    
6.  **Contextual Score (0-1)**: Relevance to your query
    
7.  Semantic similarity using embeddings
8.  Keyword matching in link text and title
9.  Meta description analysis
10.  Content preview scoring
    
11.  **Total Score**: Weighted combination for final ranking
    

**Expected Real-World Impact:** - **Research Efficiency**: Find relevant papers 10x faster by following only high-score links - **Competitive Analysis**: Automatically identify important pages on competitor sites - **Content Discovery**: Build topic-focused crawlers that stay on track - **SEO Audits**: Identify and prioritize high-value internal linking opportunities

🎣 Async URL Seeder: Automated URL Discovery at Scale
-----------------------------------------------------

**The Problem:** You want to crawl an entire domain but only have the homepage. Or worse, you want specific content types across thousands of pages. Manual URL discovery? That's a job for machines, not humans.

**My Solution:** I built Async URL Seeder—a turbocharged URL discovery engine that combines multiple sources with intelligent filtering and relevance scoring.

### Technical Architecture

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncUrlSeeder, SeedingConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-3) # Discovery sources [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-6)     source="sitemap+cc",        # Sitemap + Common Crawl [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-8)     # Filtering [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-9)     pattern="*/product/*",      # URL pattern matching [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-10)     ignore_patterns=["*/reviews/*", "*/questions/*"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/blog/releases/0.7.0/#__codelineno-3-12)     # **Discovery Methods:** - **Sitemap Mining**: Parses robots.txt and all linked sitemaps - **Common Crawl**: Queries the Common Crawl index for historical URLs - **Intelligent Crawling**: Follows links with smart depth control - **Pattern Analysis**: Learns URL structures and generates variations

**Expected Real-World Impact:** - **Migration Projects**: Discover 10,000+ URLs from legacy sites in under 60 seconds - **Market Research**: Map entire competitor ecosystems automatically - **Academic Research**: Build comprehensive datasets without manual URL collection - **SEO Audits**: Find every indexable page with content scoring - **Content Archival**: Ensure no content is left behind during site migrations

# Local Files & Raw HTML - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Prefix-Based Input Handling in Crawl4AI
=======================================

This guide will walk you through using the Crawl4AI library to crawl web pages, local HTML files, and raw HTML strings. We'll demonstrate these capabilities using a Wikipedia page as an example.

Crawling a Web URL
------------------

To crawl a live web page, provide the URL starting with `http://` or `https://`, using a `CrawlerRunConfig` object:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CacheMode, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-4) async def crawl_web(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-5)     config = CrawlerRunConfig(cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-6)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-7)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-8)             url="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/apple",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-9)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-10)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-11)         if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-12)             print("Markdown Content:") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-13)             print(result.markdown) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-14)         else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-15)             print(f"Failed to crawl: {result.error_message}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-0-17) asyncio.run(crawl_web())`

Crawling a Local HTML File
--------------------------

To crawl a local HTML file, prefix the file path with `file://`.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CacheMode, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-4) async def crawl_local_file(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-5)     local_file_path = "/path/to/apple.html"  # Replace with your file path [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-6)     file_url = f"file://{local_file_path}" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-7)     config = CrawlerRunConfig(cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-10)         result = await crawler.arun(url=file_url, config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-11)         if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-12)             print("Markdown Content from Local File:") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-13)             print(result.markdown) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-14)         else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-15)             print(f"Failed to crawl local file: {result.error_message}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-1-17) asyncio.run(crawl_local_file())`

Crawling Raw HTML Content
-------------------------

To crawl raw HTML content, prefix the HTML string with `raw:`.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-3) from crawl4ai.async_configs import CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-5) async def crawl_raw_html(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-6)     raw_html = "<html><body><h1>Hello, World!</h1></body></html>" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-7)     raw_html_url = f"raw:{raw_html}" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-8)     config = CrawlerRunConfig(bypass_cache=True) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-10)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-11)         result = await crawler.arun(url=raw_html_url, config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-12)         if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-13)             print("Markdown Content from Raw HTML:") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-14)             print(result.markdown) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-15)         else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-16)             print(f"Failed to crawl raw HTML: {result.error_message}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/local-files/#__codelineno-2-18) asyncio.run(crawl_raw_html())`

Complete Example
================

Below is a comprehensive script that:

1.  Crawls the Wikipedia page for "Apple."
2.  Saves the HTML content to a local file (`apple.html`).
3.  Crawls the local HTML file and verifies the markdown length matches the original crawl.
4.  Crawls the raw HTML content from the saved file and verifies consistency.

Conclusion
==========

With the unified `url` parameter and prefix-based handling in **Crawl4AI**, you can seamlessly handle web URLs, local HTML files, and raw HTML content. Use `CrawlerRunConfig` for flexible and consistent configuration in all scenarios.

# Simple Crawling - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Simple Crawling
===============

This guide covers the basics of web crawling with Crawl4AI. You'll learn how to set up a crawler, make your first request, and understand the response.

Basic Usage
-----------

Set up a simple crawl using `BrowserConfig` and `CrawlerRunConfig`:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-3) from crawl4ai.async_configs import BrowserConfig, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-5) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-6)     browser_config = BrowserConfig()  # Default browser configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-7)     run_config = CrawlerRunConfig()   # Default crawl run configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler(config=browser_config) as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-10)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-11)             url="https://example.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-12)             config=run_config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-13)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-14)         print(result.markdown)  # Print clean markdown content [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-16) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-0-17)     asyncio.run(main())`

Understanding the Response
--------------------------

The `arun()` method returns a `CrawlResult` object with several useful properties. Here's a quick overview (see [CrawlResult](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/crawl-result/)
 for complete details):

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-2)     markdown_generator=DefaultMarkdownGenerator( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-3)         content_filter=PruningContentFilter(threshold=0.6), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-4)         options={"ignore_links": True} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-5)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-6) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-8) result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-9)     url="https://example.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-10)     config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-11) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-13) # Different content formats [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-14) print(result.html)         # Raw HTML [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-15) print(result.cleaned_html) # Cleaned HTML [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-16) print(result.markdown.raw_markdown) # Raw markdown from cleaned html [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-17) print(result.markdown.fit_markdown) # Most relevant content in markdown [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-18) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-19) # Check success status [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-20) print(result.success)      # True if crawl succeeded [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-21) print(result.status_code)  # HTTP status code (e.g., 200, 404) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-22) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-23) # Access extracted media and links [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-24) print(result.media)        # Dictionary of found media (images, videos, audio) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-1-25) print(result.links)        # Dictionary of internal and external links`

Adding Basic Options
--------------------

Customize your crawl using `CrawlerRunConfig`:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-1) run_config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-2)     word_count_threshold=10,        # Minimum words per content block [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-3)     exclude_external_links=True,    # Remove external links [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-4)     remove_overlay_elements=True,   # Remove popups/modals [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-5)     process_iframes=True           # Process iframe content [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-6) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-8) result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-9)     url="https://example.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-10)     config=run_config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-2-11) )`

Handling Errors
---------------

Always check if the crawl was successful:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-3-1) run_config = CrawlerRunConfig() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-3-2) result = await crawler.arun(url="https://example.com", config=run_config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-3-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-3-4) if not result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-3-5)     print(f"Crawl failed: {result.error_message}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-3-6)     print(f"Status code: {result.status_code}")`

Logging and Debugging
---------------------

Enable verbose logging in `BrowserConfig`:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-4-1) browser_config = BrowserConfig(verbose=True) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-4-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-4-3) async with AsyncWebCrawler(config=browser_config) as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-4-4)     run_config = CrawlerRunConfig() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-4-5)     result = await crawler.arun(url="https://example.com", config=run_config)`

Complete Example
----------------

Here's a more comprehensive example demonstrating common usage patterns:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-3) from crawl4ai.async_configs import BrowserConfig, CrawlerRunConfig, CacheMode [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-5) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-6)     browser_config = BrowserConfig(verbose=True) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-7)     run_config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-8)         # Content filtering [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-9)         word_count_threshold=10, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-10)         excluded_tags=['form', 'header'], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-11)         exclude_external_links=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-13)         # Content processing [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-14)         process_iframes=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-15)         remove_overlay_elements=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-17)         # Cache control [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-18)         cache_mode=CacheMode.ENABLED  # Use cache if available [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-19)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-20) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-21)     async with AsyncWebCrawler(config=browser_config) as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-22)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-23)             url="https://example.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-24)             config=run_config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-25)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-26) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-27)         if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/#__codelineno-5-28)             # # Content Selection - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Content Selection
=================

Crawl4AI provides multiple ways to **select**, **filter**, and **refine** the content from your crawls. Whether you need to target a specific CSS region, exclude entire tags, filter out external links, or remove certain domains and images, **`CrawlerRunConfig`** offers a wide range of parameters.

Below, we show how to configure these parameters and combine them for precise control.

* * *

1\. CSS-Based Selection
-----------------------

There are two ways to select content from a page: using `css_selector` or the more flexible `target_elements`.

### 1.1 Using `css_selector`

A straightforward way to **limit** your crawl results to a certain region of the page is **`css_selector`** in **`CrawlerRunConfig`**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-5)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-6)         # e.g., first 30 items from Hacker News [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-7)         css_selector=".athing:nth-child(-n+30)"   [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-10)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-11)             url="https://news.ycombinator.com/newest",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-12)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-13)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-14)         print("Partial HTML length:", len(result.cleaned_html)) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-16) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-0-17)     asyncio.run(main())`

**Result**: Only elements matching that selector remain in `result.cleaned_html`.

### 1.2 Using `target_elements`

The `target_elements` parameter provides more flexibility by allowing you to target **multiple elements** for content extraction while preserving the entire page context for other features:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-5)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-6)         # Target article body and sidebar, but not other content [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-7)         target_elements=["article.main-content", "aside.sidebar"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-10)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-11)             url="https://example.com/blog-post",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-12)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-13)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-14)         print("Markdown focused on target elements") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-15)         print("Links from entire page still available:", len(result.links.get("internal", []))) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-17) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-1-18)     asyncio.run(main())`

**Key difference**: With `target_elements`, the markdown generation and structural data extraction focus on those elements, but other page elements (like links, images, and tables) are still extracted from the entire page. This gives you fine-grained control over what appears in your markdown content while preserving full page context for link analysis and media collection.

* * *

2\. Content Filtering & Exclusions
----------------------------------

### 2.1 Basic Overview

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-2)     # Content thresholds [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-3)     word_count_threshold=10,        # Minimum words per block [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-5)     # Tag exclusions [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-6)     excluded_tags=['form', 'header', 'footer', 'nav'], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-8)     # Link filtering [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-9)     exclude_external_links=True,     [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-10)     exclude_social_media_links=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-11)     # Block entire domains [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-12)     exclude_domains=["adtrackers.com", "spammynews.org"],     [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-13)     exclude_social_media_domains=["facebook.com", "twitter.com"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-14) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-15)     # Media filtering [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-16)     exclude_external_images=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-2-17) )`

**Explanation**:

*   **`word_count_threshold`**: Ignores text blocks under X words. Helps skip trivial blocks like short nav or disclaimers.
*   **`excluded_tags`**: Removes entire tags (`<form>`, `<header>`, `<footer>`, etc.).
*   **Link Filtering**:
*   `exclude_external_links`: Strips out external links and may remove them from `result.links`.
*   `exclude_social_media_links`: Removes links pointing to known social media domains.
*   `exclude_domains`: A custom list of domains to block if discovered in links.
*   `exclude_social_media_domains`: A curated list (override or add to it) for social media sites.
*   **Media Filtering**:
*   `exclude_external_images`: Discards images not hosted on the same domain as the main page (or its subdomains).

By default in case you set `exclude_social_media_links=True`, the following social media domains are excluded:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-1) [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-2)     'facebook.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-3)     'twitter.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-4)     'x.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-5)     'linkedin.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-6)     'instagram.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-7)     'pinterest.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-8)     'tiktok.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-9)     'snapchat.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-10)     'reddit.com', [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-3-11) ]`

### 2.2 Example Usage

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-4-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-4-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, css_selector="main.content",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-4-7)         word_count_threshold=10, 3\. Handling Iframes
--------------------

Some sites embed content in `<iframe>` tags. If you want that inline:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-5-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-5-2)     # Merge iframe content into the final output [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-5-3)     process_iframes=True,     [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-5-4)     remove_overlay_elements=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-5-5) )`

**Usage**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-5)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-6)         process_iframes=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-7)         remove_overlay_elements=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-10)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-11)             url="https://example.org/iframe-demo",  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-12)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-13)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-14)         print("Iframe-merged length:", len(result.cleaned_html)) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-16) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-6-17)     asyncio.run(main())`

4\. Structured Extraction Examples
----------------------------------

You can combine content selection with a more advanced extraction strategy. For instance, a **CSS-based** or **LLM-based** extraction strategy can run on the filtered HTML.

### 4.1 Pattern-Based with `JsonCssExtractionStrategy`

[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-17)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-18) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-19)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-20)         exclude_external_links=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-21)         word_count_threshold=20, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-22)         extraction_strategy=llm_strategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-23)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-24) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-25)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-26)         result = await crawler.arun(url="https://news.ycombinator.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-27)         article = json.loads(result.extracted_content) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-28)         print(article) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-29) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-30) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/content-selection/#__codelineno-8-31)     asyncio.run(main())`

Here, the crawler:

*   Filters out external links (`exclude_external_links=True`).
*   Ignores very short text blocks (`word_count_threshold=20`).
*   Passes the final HTML to your LLM strategy for an AI-driven parse.
