# Browser, Crawler & LLM Config - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

1. **BrowserConfig** – Controlling the Browser
==============================================

`BrowserConfig` focuses on **how** the browser is launched and behaves. This includes headless mode, proxies, user agents, and other environment tweaks.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, BrowserConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-3) browser_cfg = BrowserConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-4)     browser_type="chromium", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-5)     headless=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-6)     viewport_width=1280, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-7)     viewport_height=720, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-8)     proxy="http://user:pass@proxy:8080", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-9)     user_agent="Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 Chrome/116.0.0.0 Safari/537.36", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-0-10) )`

1.1 Parameter Highlights
------------------------

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`browser_type`** | `"chromium"`, `"firefox"`, `"webkit"`  <br>_(default: `"chromium"`)_ | Which browser engine to use. `"chromium"` is typical for many sites, `"firefox"` or `"webkit"` for specialized tests. |
| **`headless`** | `bool` (default: `True`) | Headless means no visible UI. `False` is handy for debugging. |
| **`viewport_width`** | `int` (default: `1080`) | Initial page width (in px). Useful for testing responsive layouts. |
| **`viewport_height`** | `int` (default: `600`) | Initial page height (in px). |
| **`proxy`** | `str` (default: `None`) | Single-proxy URL if you want all traffic to go through it, e.g. `"http://user:pass@proxy:8080"`. |
| **`proxy_config`** | `dict` (default: `None`) | For advanced or multi-proxy needs, specify details like `{"server": "...", "username": "...", ...}`. |
| **`use_persistent_context`** | `bool` (default: `False`) | If `True`, uses a **persistent** browser context (keep cookies, sessions across runs). Also sets `use_managed_browser=True`. |
| **`user_data_dir`** | `str or None` (default: `None`) | Directory to store user data (profiles, cookies). Must be set if you want permanent sessions. |
| **`ignore_https_errors`** | `bool` (default: `True`) | If `True`, continues despite invalid certificates (common in dev/staging). |
| **`java_script_enabled`** | `bool` (default: `True`) | Disable if you want no JS overhead, or if only static content is needed. |
| **`cookies`** | `list` (default: `[]`) | Pre-set cookies, each a dict like `{"name": "session", "value": "...", "url": "..."}`. |
| **`headers`** | `dict` (default: `{}`) | Extra HTTP headers for every request, e.g. `{"Accept-Language": "en-US"}`. |
| **`user_agent`** | `str` (default: Chrome-based UA) | Your custom or random user agent. `user_agent_mode="random"` can shuffle it. |
| **`light_mode`** | `bool` (default: `False`) | Disables some background features for performance gains. |
| **`text_mode`** | `bool` (default: `False`) | If `True`, tries to disable images/other heavy content for speed. |
| **`use_managed_browser`** | `bool` (default: `False`) | For advanced “managed” interactions (debugging, CDP usage). Typically set automatically if persistent context is on. |
| **`extra_args`** | `list` (default: `[]`) | Additional flags for the underlying browser process, e.g. `["--disable-extensions"]`. |

**Tips**: - Set `headless=False` to visually **debug** how pages load or how interactions proceed.  
\- If you need **authentication** storage or repeated sessions, consider `use_persistent_context=True` and specify `user_data_dir`.  
\- For large pages, you might need a bigger `viewport_width` and `viewport_height` to handle dynamic content.

* * *

2. **CrawlerRunConfig** – Controlling Each Crawl
================================================

While `BrowserConfig` sets up the **environment**, `CrawlerRunConfig` details **how** each **crawl operation** should behave: caching, content filtering, link or domain blocking, timeouts, JavaScript code, etc.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-3) run_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-4)     wait_for="css:.main-content", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-5)     word_count_threshold=15, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-6)     excluded_tags=["nav", "footer"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-7)     exclude_external_links=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-8)     stream=True,  # Enable streaming for arun_many() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-1-9) )`

2.1 Parameter Highlights
------------------------

We group them by category.

### A) **Content Processing**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`word_count_threshold`** | `int` (default: ~200) | Skips text blocks below X words. Helps ignore trivial sections. |
| **`extraction_strategy`** | `ExtractionStrategy` (default: None) | If set, extracts structured data (CSS-based, LLM-based, etc.). |
| **`markdown_generator`** | `MarkdownGenerationStrategy` (None) | If you want specialized markdown output (citations, filtering, chunking, etc.). Can be customized with options such as `content_source` parameter to select the HTML input source ('cleaned\_html', 'raw\_html', or 'fit\_html'). |
| **`css_selector`** | `str` (None) | Retains only the part of the page matching this selector. Affects the entire extraction process. |
| **`target_elements`** | `List[str]` (None) | List of CSS selectors for elements to focus on for markdown generation and data extraction, while still processing the entire page for links, media, etc. Provides more flexibility than `css_selector`. |
| **`excluded_tags`** | `list` (None) | Removes entire tags (e.g. `["script", "style"]`). |
| **`excluded_selector`** | `str` (None) | Like `css_selector` but to exclude. E.g. `"#ads, .tracker"`. |
| **`only_text`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, tries to extract text-only content. |
| **`prettiify`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, beautifies final HTML (slower, purely cosmetic). |
| **`keep_data_attributes`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, preserve `data-*` attributes in cleaned HTML. |
| **`remove_forms`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, remove all `<form>` elements. |

* * *

### B) **Caching & Session**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`cache_mode`** | `CacheMode or None` | Controls how caching is handled (`ENABLED`, `BYPASS`, `DISABLED`, etc.). If `None`, typically defaults to `ENABLED`. |
| **`session_id`** | `str or None` | Assign a unique ID to reuse a single browser session across multiple `arun()` calls. |
| **`bypass_cache`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, acts like `CacheMode.BYPASS`. |
| **`disable_cache`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, acts like `CacheMode.DISABLED`. |
| **`no_cache_read`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, acts like `CacheMode.WRITE_ONLY` (writes cache but never reads). |
| **`no_cache_write`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, acts like `CacheMode.READ_ONLY` (reads cache but never writes). |

Use these for controlling whether you read or write from a local content cache. Handy for large batch crawls or repeated site visits.

* * *

### C) **Page Navigation & Timing**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`wait_until`** | `str` (domcontentloaded) | Condition for navigation to “complete”. Often `"networkidle"` or `"domcontentloaded"`. |
| **`page_timeout`** | `int` (60000 ms) | Timeout for page navigation or JS steps. Increase for slow sites. |
| **`wait_for`** | `str or None` | Wait for a CSS (`"css:selector"`) or JS (`"js:() => bool"`) condition before content extraction. |
| **`wait_for_images`** | `bool` (False) | Wait for images to load before finishing. Slows down if you only want text. |
| **`delay_before_return_html`** | `float` (0.1) | Additional pause (seconds) before final HTML is captured. Good for last-second updates. |
| **`check_robots_txt`** | `bool` (False) | Whether to check and respect robots.txt rules before crawling. If True, caches robots.txt for efficiency. |
| **`mean_delay`** and **`max_range`** | `float` (0.1, 0.3) | If you call `arun_many()`, these define random delay intervals between crawls, helping avoid detection or rate limits. |
| **`semaphore_count`** | `int` (5) | Max concurrency for `arun_many()`. Increase if you have resources for parallel crawls. |

* * *

### D) **Page Interaction**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`js_code`** | `str or list[str]` (None) | JavaScript to run after load. E.g. `"document.querySelector('button')?.click();"`. |
| **`js_only`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, indicates we’re reusing an existing session and only applying JS. No full reload. |
| **`ignore_body_visibility`** | `bool` (True) | Skip checking if `<body>` is visible. Usually best to keep `True`. |
| **`scan_full_page`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, auto-scroll the page to load dynamic content (infinite scroll). |
| **`scroll_delay`** | `float` (0.2) | Delay between scroll steps if `scan_full_page=True`. |
| **`process_iframes`** | `bool` (False) | Inlines iframe content for single-page extraction. |
| **`remove_overlay_elements`** | `bool` (False) | Removes potential modals/popups blocking the main content. |
| **`simulate_user`** | `bool` (False) | Simulate user interactions (mouse movements) to avoid bot detection. |
| **`override_navigator`** | `bool` (False) | Override `navigator` properties in JS for stealth. |
| **`magic`** | `bool` (False) | Automatic handling of popups/consent banners. Experimental. |
| **`adjust_viewport_to_content`** | `bool` (False) | Resizes viewport to match page content height. |

If your page is a single-page app with repeated JS updates, set `js_only=True` in subsequent calls, plus a `session_id` for reusing the same tab.

* * *

### E) **Media Handling**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`screenshot`** | `bool` (False) | Capture a screenshot (base64) in `result.screenshot`. |
| **`screenshot_wait_for`** | `float or None` | Extra wait time before the screenshot. |
| **`screenshot_height_threshold`** | `int` (~20000) | If the page is taller than this, alternate screenshot strategies are used. |
| **`pdf`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, returns a PDF in `result.pdf`. |
| **`capture_mhtml`** | `bool` (False) | If `True`, captures an MHTML snapshot of the page in `result.mhtml`. MHTML includes all page resources (CSS, images, etc.) in a single file. |
| **`image_description_min_word_threshold`** | `int` (~50) | Minimum words for an image’s alt text or description to be considered valid. |
| **`image_score_threshold`** | `int` (~3) | Filter out low-scoring images. The crawler scores images by relevance (size, context, etc.). |
| **`exclude_external_images`** | `bool` (False) | Exclude images from other domains. |

* * *

### F) **Link/Domain Handling**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`exclude_social_media_domains`** | `list` (e.g. Facebook/Twitter) | A default list can be extended. Any link to these domains is removed from final output. |
| **`exclude_external_links`** | `bool` (False) | Removes all links pointing outside the current domain. |
| **`exclude_social_media_links`** | `bool` (False) | Strips links specifically to social sites (like Facebook or Twitter). |
| **`exclude_domains`** | `list` (\[\]) | Provide a custom list of domains to exclude (like `["ads.com", "trackers.io"]`). |

Use these for link-level content filtering (often to keep crawls “internal” or to remove spammy domains).

* * *

### G) **Debug & Logging**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`verbose`** | `bool` (True) | Prints logs detailing each step of crawling, interactions, or errors. |
| **`log_console`** | `bool` (False) | Logs the page’s JavaScript console output if you want deeper JS debugging. |

* * *

### H) **Virtual Scroll Configuration**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`virtual_scroll_config`** | `VirtualScrollConfig or dict` (None) | Configuration for handling virtualized scrolling on sites like Twitter/Instagram where content is replaced rather than appended. |

When sites use virtual scrolling (content replaced as you scroll), use `VirtualScrollConfig`:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-1) from crawl4ai import VirtualScrollConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-3) virtual_config = VirtualScrollConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-4)     container_selector="#timeline",    # CSS selector for scrollable container [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-5)     scroll_count=30,                   # Number of times to scroll [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-6)     scroll_by="container_height",      # How much to scroll: "container_height", "page_height", or pixels (e.g. 500) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-7)     wait_after_scroll=0.5             # Seconds to wait after each scroll for content to load [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-10) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-11)     virtual_scroll_config=virtual_config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-2-12) )`

**VirtualScrollConfig Parameters:**

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`container_selector`** | `str` (required) | CSS selector for the scrollable container (e.g., `"#feed"`, `".timeline"`) |
| **`scroll_count`** | `int` (10) | Maximum number of scrolls to perform |
| **`scroll_by`** | `str or int` ("container\_height") | Scroll amount: `"container_height"`, `"page_height"`, or pixels (e.g., `500`) |
| **`wait_after_scroll`** | `float` (0.5) | Time in seconds to wait after each scroll for new content to load |

**When to use Virtual Scroll vs scan\_full\_page:** - Use `virtual_scroll_config` when content is **replaced** during scroll (Twitter, Instagram) - Use `scan_full_page` when content is **appended** during scroll (traditional infinite scroll)

See [Virtual Scroll documentation](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll.md)
 for detailed examples.

\---## 2.2 Helper Methods

Both `BrowserConfig` and `CrawlerRunConfig` provide a `clone()` method to create modified copies:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-1) # Create a base configuration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-2) base_config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-3)     cache_mode=CacheMode.ENABLED, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-4)     word_count_threshold=200 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-7) # Create variations using clone() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-8) stream_config = base_config.clone(stream=True) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-9) no_cache_config = base_config.clone( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-10)     cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-11)     stream=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-3-12) )`

The `clone()` method is particularly useful when you need slightly different configurations for different use cases, without modifying the original config.

2.3 Example Usage
-----------------

2.4 Compliance & Ethics
-----------------------

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`check_robots_txt`** | `bool` (False) | When True, checks and respects robots.txt rules before crawling. Uses efficient caching with SQLite backend. |
| **`user_agent`** | `str` (None) | User agent string to identify your crawler. Used for robots.txt checking when enabled. |

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-5-1) run_config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-5-2)     check_robots_txt=True,  # Enable robots.txt compliance [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-5-3)     user_agent="MyBot/1.0"  # Identify your crawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-5-4) )`

3\. **LLMConfig** - Setting up LLM providers
============================================

LLMConfig is useful to pass LLM provider config to strategies and functions that rely on LLMs to do extraction, filtering, schema generation etc. Currently it can be used in the following -

1.  LLMExtractionStrategy
2.  LLMContentFilter
3.  JsonCssExtractionStrategy.generate\_schema
4.  JsonXPathExtractionStrategy.generate\_schema

3.1 Parameters
--------------

| **Parameter** | **Type / Default** | **What It Does** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **`provider`** | `"ollama/llama3","groq/llama3-70b-8192","groq/llama3-8b-8192", "openai/gpt-4o-mini" ,"openai/gpt-4o","openai/o1-mini","openai/o1-preview","openai/o3-mini","openai/o3-mini-high","anthropic/claude-3-haiku-20240307","anthropic/claude-3-opus-20240229","anthropic/claude-3-sonnet-20240229","anthropic/claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620","gemini/gemini-pro","gemini/gemini-1.5-pro","gemini/gemini-2.0-flash","gemini/gemini-2.0-flash-exp","gemini/gemini-2.0-flash-lite-preview-02-05","deepseek/deepseek-chat"`  <br>_(default: `"openai/gpt-4o-mini"`)_ | Which LLM provider to use. |
| **`api_token`** | 1.Optional. When not provided explicitly, api\_token will be read from environment variables based on provider. For example: If a gemini model is passed as provider then,`"GEMINI_API_KEY"` will be read from environment variables  <br>2\. API token of LLM provider  <br>eg: `api_token = "gsk_1ClHGGJ7Lpn4WGybR7vNWGdyb3FY7zXEw3SCiy0BAVM9lL8CQv"`  <br>3\. Environment variable - use with prefix "env:"  <br>eg:`api_token = "env: GROQ_API_KEY"` | API token to use for the given provider |
| **`base_url`** | Optional. Custom API endpoint | If your provider has a custom endpoint |

3.2 Example Usage
-----------------

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-6-1) llm_config = LLMConfig(provider="openai/gpt-4o-mini", api_token=os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY"))`

4\. Putting It All Together
---------------------------

*   **Use** `BrowserConfig` for **global** browser settings: engine, headless, proxy, user agent.
*   **Use** `CrawlerRunConfig` for each crawl’s **context**: how to filter content, handle caching, wait for dynamic elements, or run JS.
*   **Pass** both configs to `AsyncWebCrawler` (the `BrowserConfig`) and then to `arun()` (the `CrawlerRunConfig`).
*   **Use** `LLMConfig` for LLM provider configurations that can be used across all extraction, filtering, schema generation tasks. Can be used in - `LLMExtractionStrategy`, `LLMContentFilter`, `JsonCssExtractionStrategy.generate_schema` & `JsonXPathExtractionStrategy.generate_schema`

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-7-1) # Create a modified copy with the clone() method [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-7-2) stream_cfg = run_cfg.clone( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-7-3)     stream=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-7-4)     cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/#__codelineno-7-5) )`

# Page Interaction - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Page Interaction
================

Crawl4AI provides powerful features for interacting with **dynamic** webpages, handling JavaScript execution, waiting for conditions, and managing multi-step flows. By combining **js\_code**, **wait\_for**, and certain **CrawlerRunConfig** parameters, you can:

1.  Click “Load More” buttons
2.  Fill forms and submit them
3.  Wait for elements or data to appear
4.  Reuse sessions across multiple steps

Below is a quick overview of how to do it.

* * *

1\. JavaScript Execution
------------------------

### Basic Execution

**`js_code`** in **`CrawlerRunConfig`** accepts either a single JS string or a list of JS snippets.  
**Example**: We’ll scroll to the bottom of the page, then optionally click a “Load More” button.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-5)     # Single JS command [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-6)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-7)         js_code="window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight);" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-10)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-11)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-12)             url="https://news.ycombinator.com",  # Example site [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-13)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-14)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-15)         print("Crawled length:", len(result.cleaned_html)) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-17)     # Multiple commands [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-18)     js_commands = [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-19)         "window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight);", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-20)         # 'More' link on Hacker News [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-21)         "document.querySelector('a.morelink')?.click();",   [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-22)     ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-23)     config = CrawlerRunConfig(js_code=js_commands) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-24) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-25)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-26)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-27)             url="https://news.ycombinator.com",  # Another pass [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-28)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-29)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-30)         print("After scroll+click, length:", len(result.cleaned_html)) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-31) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-32) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-0-33)     asyncio.run(main())`

**Relevant `CrawlerRunConfig` params**: - **`js_code`**: A string or list of strings with JavaScript to run after the page loads. - **`js_only`**: If set to `True` on subsequent calls, indicates we’re continuing an existing session without a new full navigation.  
\- **`session_id`**: If you want to keep the same page across multiple calls, specify an ID.

* * *

2\. Wait Conditions
-------------------

### 2.1 CSS-Based Waiting

Sometimes, you just want to wait for a specific element to appear. For example:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-5)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-6)         # Wait for at least 30 items on Hacker News [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-7)         wait_for="css:.athing:nth-child(30)"   [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-10)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-11)             url="https://news.ycombinator.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-12)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-13)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-14)         print("We have at least 30 items loaded!") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-15)         # Rough check [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-16)         print("Total items in HTML:", result.cleaned_html.count("athing"))   [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-18) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-1-19)     asyncio.run(main())`

**Key param**: - **`wait_for="css:..."`**: Tells the crawler to wait until that CSS selector is present.

### 2.2 JavaScript-Based Waiting

For more complex conditions (e.g., waiting for content length to exceed a threshold), prefix `js:`:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-2-1) wait_condition = """() => { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-2-2)     const items = document.querySelectorAll('.athing'); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-2-3)     return items.length > 50;  // Wait for at least 51 items [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-2-4) }""" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-2-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-2-6) config = CrawlerRunConfig(wait_for=f"js:{wait_condition}")`

**Behind the Scenes**: Crawl4AI keeps polling the JS function until it returns `true` or a timeout occurs.

* * *

3\. Handling Dynamic Content
----------------------------

Many modern sites require **multiple steps**: scrolling, clicking “Load More,” or updating via JavaScript. Below are typical patterns.

### 3.1 Load More Example (Hacker News “More” Link)

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-5)     # Step 1: Load initial Hacker News page [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-6)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-7)         wait_for="css:.athing:nth-child(30)"  # Wait for 30 items [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-10)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-11)             url="https://news.ycombinator.com", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-12)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-13)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-14)         print("Initial items loaded.") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-16)         # Step 2: Let's scroll and click the "More" link [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-17)         load_more_js = [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-18)             "window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight);", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-19)             # The "More" link at page bottom [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-20)             "document.querySelector('a.morelink')?.click();"   [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-21)         ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-22) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-23)         next_page_conf = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-24)             js_code=load_more_js, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-25)             wait_for="""js:() => { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-26)                 return document.querySelectorAll('.athing').length > 30; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-27)             }""", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-28)             # Mark that we do not re-navigate, but run JS in the same session: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-29)             js_only=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-30)             session_id="hn_session" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-31)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-32) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-33)         # Re-use the same crawler session [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-34)         result2 = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-35)             url="https://news.ycombinator.com",  # same URL but continuing session [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-36)             config=next_page_conf [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-37)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-38)         total_items = result2.cleaned_html.count("athing") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-39)         print("Items after load-more:", total_items) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-40) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-41) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-3-42)     asyncio.run(main())`

**Key params**: - **`session_id="hn_session"`**: Keep the same page across multiple calls to `arun()`. - **`js_only=True`**: We’re not performing a full reload, just applying JS in the existing page. - **`wait_for`** with `js:`: Wait for item count to grow beyond 30.

* * *

### 3.2 Form Interaction

If the site has a search or login form, you can fill fields and submit them with **`js_code`**. For instance, if GitHub had a local search form:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-1) js_form_interaction = """ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-2) document.querySelector('#your-search').value = 'TypeScript commits'; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-3) document.querySelector('form').submit(); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-4) """ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-6) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-7)     js_code=js_form_interaction, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-8)     wait_for="css:.commit" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-9) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-4-10) result = await crawler.arun(url="https://github.com/search", config=config)`

**In reality**: Replace IDs or classes with the real site’s form selectors.

* * *

4\. Timing Control
------------------

1. **`page_timeout`** (ms): Overall page load or script execution time limit.  
2. **`delay_before_return_html`** (seconds): Wait an extra moment before capturing the final HTML.  
3. **`mean_delay`** & **`max_range`**: If you call `arun_many()` with multiple URLs, these add a random pause between each request.

**Example**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-5-1) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-5-2)     page_timeout=60000,  # 60s limit [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-5-3)     delay_before_return_html=2.5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-5-4) )`

* * *

5\. Multi-Step Interaction Example
----------------------------------

Below is a simplified script that does multiple “Load More” clicks on GitHub’s TypeScript commits page. It **re-uses** the same session to accumulate new commits each time. The code includes the relevant **`CrawlerRunConfig`** parameters you’d rely on.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, BrowserConfig, CrawlerRunConfig, CacheMode [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-4) async def multi_page_commits(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-5)     browser_cfg = BrowserConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-6)         headless=False,  # Visible for demonstration [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-7)         verbose=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-8)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-9)     session_id = "github_ts_commits" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-11)     base_wait = """js:() => { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-12)         const commits = document.querySelectorAll('li.Box-sc-g0xbh4-0 h4'); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-13)         return commits.length > 0; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-14)     }""" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-16)     # Step 1: Load initial commits [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-17)     config1 = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-18)         wait_for=base_wait, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-19)         session_id=session_id, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-20)         cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-21)         # Not using js_only yet since it's our first load [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-22)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-23) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-24)     async with AsyncWebCrawler(config=browser_cfg) as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-25)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-26)             url="https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/commits/main", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-27)             config=config1 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-28)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-29)         print("Initial commits loaded. Count:", result.cleaned_html.count("commit")) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-30) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-31)         # Step 2: For subsequent pages, we run JS to click 'Next Page' if it exists [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-32)         js_next_page = """ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-33)         const selector = 'a[data-testid="pagination-next-button"]'; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-34)         const button = document.querySelector(selector); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-35)         if (button) button.click(); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-36)         """ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-37) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-38)         # Wait until new commits appear [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-39)         wait_for_more = """js:() => { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-40)             const commits = document.querySelectorAll('li.Box-sc-g0xbh4-0 h4'); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-41)             if (!window.firstCommit && commits.length>0) { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-42)                 window.firstCommit = commits[0].textContent; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-43)                 return false; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-44)             } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-45)             // If top commit changes, we have new commits [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-46)             const topNow = commits[0]?.textContent.trim(); [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-47)             return topNow && topNow !== window.firstCommit; [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-48)         }""" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-49) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-50)         for page in range(2):  # let's do 2 more "Next" pages [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-51)             config_next = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-52)                 session_id=session_id, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-53)                 js_code=js_next_page, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-54)                 wait_for=wait_for_more, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-55)                 js_only=True,       # We're continuing from the open tab [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-56)                 cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-57)             ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-58)             result2 = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-59)                 url="https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/commits/main", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-60)                 config=config_next [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-61)             ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-62)             print(f"Page {page+2} commits count:", result2.cleaned_html.count("commit")) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-63) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-64)         # Optionally kill session [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-65)         await crawler.crawler_strategy.kill_session(session_id) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-66) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-67) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-68)     await multi_page_commits() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-69) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-70) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-6-71)     asyncio.run(main())`

**Key Points**:

*   **`session_id`**: Keep the same page open.
*   **`js_code`** + **`wait_for`** + **`js_only=True`**: We do partial refreshes, waiting for new commits to appear.
*   **`cache_mode=CacheMode.BYPASS`** ensures we always see fresh data each step.

* * *

6\. Combine Interaction with Extraction
---------------------------------------

Once dynamic content is loaded, you can attach an **`extraction_strategy`** (like `JsonCssExtractionStrategy` or `LLMExtractionStrategy`). For example:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-1) from crawl4ai import JsonCssExtractionStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-3) schema = { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-4)     "name": "Commits", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-5)     "baseSelector": "li.Box-sc-g0xbh4-0", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-6)     "fields": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-7)         {"name": "title", "selector": "h4.markdown-title", "type": "text"} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-8)     ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-9) } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-10) config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-11)     session_id="ts_commits_session", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-12)     js_code=js_next_page, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-13)     wait_for=wait_for_more, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-14)     extraction_strategy=JsonCssExtractionStrategy(schema) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-7-15) )`

When done, check `result.extracted_content` for the JSON.

* * *

7\. Relevant `CrawlerRunConfig` Parameters
------------------------------------------

Below are the key interaction-related parameters in `CrawlerRunConfig`. For a full list, see [Configuration Parameters](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/)
.

*   **`js_code`**: JavaScript to run after initial load.
*   **`js_only`**: If `True`, no new page navigation—only JS in the existing session.
*   **`wait_for`**: CSS (`"css:..."`) or JS (`"js:..."`) expression to wait for.
*   **`session_id`**: Reuse the same page across calls.
*   **`cache_mode`**: Whether to read/write from the cache or bypass.
*   **`remove_overlay_elements`**: Remove certain popups automatically.
*   **`simulate_user`, `override_navigator`, `magic`**: Anti-bot or “human-like” interactions.

* * *

8\. Conclusion
--------------

Crawl4AI’s **page interaction** features let you:

1. **Execute JavaScript** for scrolling, clicks, or form filling.  
2. **Wait** for CSS or custom JS conditions before capturing data.  
3. **Handle** multi-step flows (like “Load More”) with partial reloads or persistent sessions.  
4\. Combine with **structured extraction** for dynamic sites.

With these tools, you can scrape modern, interactive webpages confidently. For advanced hooking, user simulation, or in-depth config, check the [API reference](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/parameters/)
 or related advanced docs. Happy scripting!

* * *

9\. Virtual Scrolling
---------------------

For sites that use **virtual scrolling** (where content is replaced rather than appended as you scroll, like Twitter or Instagram), Crawl4AI provides a dedicated `VirtualScrollConfig`:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig, VirtualScrollConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-3) async def crawl_twitter_timeline(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-4)     # Configure virtual scroll for Twitter-like feeds [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-5)     virtual_config = VirtualScrollConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-6)         container_selector="[data-testid='primaryColumn']",  # Twitter's main column [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-7)         scroll_count=30,                # Scroll 30 times [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-8)         scroll_by="container_height",   # Scroll by container height each time [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-9)         wait_after_scroll=1.0          # Wait 1 second after each scroll [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-10)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-12)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-13)         virtual_scroll_config=virtual_config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-14)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-16)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-17)         result = await crawler.arun( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-18)             url="https://twitter.com/search?q=AI", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-19)             config=config [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-20)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/page-interaction/#__codelineno-8-21)         # result.html now contains ALL tweets from the virtual scroll`

### Virtual Scroll vs JavaScript Scrolling

| Feature | Virtual Scroll | JS Code Scrolling |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Use Case** | Content replaced during scroll | Content appended or simple scroll |
| **Configuration** | `VirtualScrollConfig` object | `js_code` with scroll commands |
| **Automatic Merging** | Yes - merges all unique content | No - captures final state only |
| **Best For** | Twitter, Instagram, virtual tables | Traditional pages, load more buttons |

For detailed examples and configuration options, see the [Virtual Scroll documentation](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/advanced/virtual-scroll/)
.

* * *

# C4A-Script Reference - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

C4A-Script API Reference
========================

Complete reference for all C4A-Script commands, syntax, and advanced features.

Command Categories
------------------

### 🧭 Navigation Commands

Navigate between pages and manage browser history.

#### `GO <url>`

Navigate to a specific URL.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-0-1) GO <url>`

**Parameters:** - `url` - Target URL (string)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-1-1) GO https://example.com [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-1-2) GO https://api.example.com/login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-1-3) GO /relative/path`

**Notes:** - Supports both absolute and relative URLs - Automatically handles protocol detection - Waits for page load to complete

* * *

#### `RELOAD`

Refresh the current page.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-2-1) RELOAD`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-3-1) RELOAD`

**Notes:** - Equivalent to pressing F5 or clicking browser refresh - Waits for page reload to complete - Preserves current URL

* * *

#### `BACK`

Navigate back in browser history.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-4-1) BACK`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-5-1) BACK`

**Notes:** - Equivalent to clicking browser back button - Does nothing if no previous page exists - Waits for navigation to complete

* * *

#### `FORWARD`

Navigate forward in browser history.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-6-1) FORWARD`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-7-1) FORWARD`

**Notes:** - Equivalent to clicking browser forward button - Does nothing if no next page exists - Waits for navigation to complete

### ⏱️ Wait Commands

Control timing and synchronization with page elements.

#### `WAIT <time>`

Wait for a specified number of seconds.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-8-1) WAIT <seconds>`

**Parameters:** - `seconds` - Number of seconds to wait (number)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-9-1) WAIT 3 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-9-2) WAIT 1.5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-9-3) WAIT 10`

**Notes:** - Accepts decimal values - Useful for giving dynamic content time to load - Non-blocking for other browser operations

* * *

#### `WAIT <selector> <timeout>`

Wait for an element to appear on the page.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-10-1) WAIT `<selector>` <timeout>``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector for the element (string in backticks) - `timeout` - Maximum seconds to wait (number)

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-11-1) WAIT `#content` 10 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-11-2) WAIT `.loading-spinner` 5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-11-3) WAIT `button[type="submit"]` 15 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-11-4) WAIT `.results .item:first-child` 8``

**Notes:** - Fails if element doesn't appear within timeout - More reliable than fixed time waits - Supports complex CSS selectors

* * *

#### `WAIT "<text>" <timeout>`

Wait for specific text to appear anywhere on the page.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-12-1) WAIT "<text>" <timeout>`

**Parameters:** - `text` - Text content to wait for (string in quotes) - `timeout` - Maximum seconds to wait (number)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-13-1) WAIT "Loading complete" 10 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-13-2) WAIT "Welcome back" 5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-13-3) WAIT "Search results" 15`

**Notes:** - Case-sensitive text matching - Searches entire page content - Useful for dynamic status messages

### 🖱️ Mouse Commands

Simulate mouse interactions and movements.

#### `CLICK <selector>`

Click on an element specified by CSS selector.

**Syntax:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-14-1) CLICK `<selector>` ``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector for the element (string in backticks)

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-15-1) CLICK `#submit-button` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-15-2) CLICK `.menu-item:first-child` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-15-3) CLICK `button[data-action="save"]` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-15-4) CLICK `a[href="/dashboard"]` ``

**Notes:** - Waits for element to be clickable - Scrolls element into view if necessary - Handles overlapping elements intelligently

* * *

#### `CLICK <x> <y>`

Click at specific coordinates on the page.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-16-1) CLICK <x> <y>`

**Parameters:** - `x` - X coordinate in pixels (number) - `y` - Y coordinate in pixels (number)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-17-1) CLICK 100 200 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-17-2) CLICK 500 300 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-17-3) CLICK 0 0`

**Notes:** - Coordinates are relative to viewport - Useful when element selectors are unreliable - Consider responsive design implications

* * *

#### `DOUBLE_CLICK <selector>`

Double-click on an element.

**Syntax:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-18-1) DOUBLE_CLICK `<selector>` ``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector for the element (string in backticks)

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-19-1) DOUBLE_CLICK `.file-icon` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-19-2) DOUBLE_CLICK `#editable-cell` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-19-3) DOUBLE_CLICK `.expandable-item` ``

**Notes:** - Triggers dblclick event - Common for opening files or editing inline content - Timing between clicks is automatically handled

* * *

#### `RIGHT_CLICK <selector>`

Right-click on an element to open context menu.

**Syntax:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-20-1) RIGHT_CLICK `<selector>` ``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector for the element (string in backticks)

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-21-1) RIGHT_CLICK `#context-target` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-21-2) RIGHT_CLICK `.menu-trigger` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-21-3) RIGHT_CLICK `img.thumbnail` ``

**Notes:** - Opens browser/application context menu - Useful for testing context menu interactions - May be blocked by some applications

* * *

#### `SCROLL <direction> <amount>`

Scroll the page in a specified direction.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-22-1) SCROLL <direction> <amount>`

**Parameters:** - `direction` - Direction to scroll: `UP`, `DOWN`, `LEFT`, `RIGHT` - `amount` - Number of pixels to scroll (number)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-23-1) SCROLL DOWN 500 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-23-2) SCROLL UP 200 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-23-3) SCROLL LEFT 100 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-23-4) SCROLL RIGHT 300`

**Notes:** - Smooth scrolling animation - Useful for infinite scroll pages - Amount can be larger than viewport

* * *

#### `MOVE <x> <y>`

Move mouse cursor to specific coordinates.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-24-1) MOVE <x> <y>`

**Parameters:** - `x` - X coordinate in pixels (number) - `y` - Y coordinate in pixels (number)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-25-1) MOVE 200 100 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-25-2) MOVE 500 400`

**Notes:** - Triggers hover effects - Useful for testing mouseover interactions - Does not click, only moves cursor

* * *

#### `DRAG <x1> <y1> <x2> <y2>`

Drag from one point to another.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-26-1) DRAG <x1> <y1> <x2> <y2>`

**Parameters:** - `x1`, `y1` - Starting coordinates (numbers) - `x2`, `y2` - Ending coordinates (numbers)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-27-1) DRAG 100 100 500 300 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-27-2) DRAG 0 200 400 200`

**Notes:** - Simulates click, drag, and release - Useful for sliders, resizing, reordering - Smooth drag animation

### ⌨️ Keyboard Commands

Simulate keyboard input and key presses.

#### `TYPE "<text>"`

Type text into the currently focused element.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-28-1) TYPE "<text>"`

**Parameters:** - `text` - Text to type (string in quotes)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-29-1) TYPE "Hello, World!" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-29-2) TYPE "user@example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-29-3) TYPE "Password123!"`

**Notes:** - Requires an input element to be focused - Types character by character with realistic timing - Supports special characters and Unicode

* * *

#### `TYPE $<variable>`

Type the value of a variable.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-30-1) TYPE $<variable>`

**Parameters:** - `variable` - Variable name (without quotes)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-31-1) SETVAR email = "user@example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-31-2) TYPE $email`

**Notes:** - Variable must be defined with SETVAR first - Variable values are strings - Useful for reusable credentials or data

* * *

#### `PRESS <key>`

Press and release a special key.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-32-1) PRESS <key>`

**Parameters:** - `key` - Key name (see supported keys below)

**Supported Keys:** - `Tab`, `Enter`, `Escape`, `Space` - `ArrowUp`, `ArrowDown`, `ArrowLeft`, `ArrowRight` - `Delete`, `Backspace` - `Home`, `End`, `PageUp`, `PageDown`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-33-1) PRESS Tab [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-33-2) PRESS Enter [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-33-3) PRESS Escape [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-33-4) PRESS ArrowDown`

**Notes:** - Simulates actual key press and release - Useful for form navigation and shortcuts - Case-sensitive key names

* * *

#### `KEY_DOWN <key>`

Hold down a modifier key.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-34-1) KEY_DOWN <key>`

**Parameters:** - `key` - Modifier key: `Shift`, `Control`, `Alt`, `Meta`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-35-1) KEY_DOWN Shift [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-35-2) KEY_DOWN Control`

**Notes:** - Must be paired with KEY\_UP - Useful for key combinations - Meta key is Cmd on Mac, Windows key on PC

* * *

#### `KEY_UP <key>`

Release a modifier key.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-36-1) KEY_UP <key>`

**Parameters:** - `key` - Modifier key: `Shift`, `Control`, `Alt`, `Meta`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-37-1) KEY_UP Shift [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-37-2) KEY_UP Control`

**Notes:** - Must be paired with KEY\_DOWN - Releases the specified modifier key - Good practice to always release held keys

* * *

#### `CLEAR <selector>`

Clear the content of an input field.

**Syntax:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-38-1) CLEAR `<selector>` ``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector for input element (string in backticks)

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-39-1) CLEAR `#search-box` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-39-2) CLEAR `input[name="email"]` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-39-3) CLEAR `.form-input:first-child` ``

**Notes:** - Works with input, textarea elements - Faster than selecting all and deleting - Triggers appropriate change events

* * *

#### `SET <selector> "<value>"`

Set the value of an input field directly.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-40-1) SET `<selector>` "<value>"``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector for input element (string in backticks) - `value` - Value to set (string in quotes)

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-41-1) SET `#email` "user@example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-41-2) SET `#age` "25" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-41-3) SET `textarea#message` "Hello, this is a test message."``

**Notes:** - Directly sets value without typing animation - Faster than TYPE for long text - Triggers change and input events

### 🔀 Control Flow Commands

Add conditional logic and loops to your scripts.

#### `IF (EXISTS <selector>) THEN <command>`

Execute command if element exists.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-42-1) IF (EXISTS `<selector>`) THEN <command>``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector to check (string in backticks) - `command` - Command to execute if condition is true

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-43-1) IF (EXISTS `.cookie-banner`) THEN CLICK `.accept-cookies` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-43-2) IF (EXISTS `#popup-modal`) THEN CLICK `.close-button` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-43-3) IF (EXISTS `.error-message`) THEN RELOAD``

**Notes:** - Checks for element existence at time of execution - Does not wait for element to appear - Can be combined with ELSE

* * *

#### `IF (EXISTS <selector>) THEN <command> ELSE <command>`

Execute command based on element existence.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-44-1) IF (EXISTS `<selector>`) THEN <command> ELSE <command>``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector to check (string in backticks) - First `command` - Execute if condition is true - Second `command` - Execute if condition is false

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-45-1) IF (EXISTS `.user-menu`) THEN CLICK `.logout` ELSE CLICK `.login` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-45-2) IF (EXISTS `.loading`) THEN WAIT 5 ELSE CLICK `#continue` ``

**Notes:** - Exactly one command will be executed - Useful for handling different page states - Commands must be on same line

* * *

#### `IF (NOT EXISTS <selector>) THEN <command>`

Execute command if element does not exist.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-46-1) IF (NOT EXISTS `<selector>`) THEN <command>``

**Parameters:** - `selector` - CSS selector to check (string in backticks) - `command` - Command to execute if element doesn't exist

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-47-1) IF (NOT EXISTS `.logged-in`) THEN GO /login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-47-2) IF (NOT EXISTS `.results`) THEN CLICK `#search-button` ``

**Notes:** - Inverse of EXISTS condition - Useful for error handling - Can check for missing required elements

* * *

#### `IF (<javascript>) THEN <command>`

Execute command based on JavaScript condition.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-48-1) IF (`<javascript>`) THEN <command>``

**Parameters:** - `javascript` - JavaScript expression that returns boolean (string in backticks) - `command` - Command to execute if condition is true

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-49-1) IF (`window.innerWidth < 768`) THEN CLICK `.mobile-menu` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-49-2) IF (`document.readyState === "complete"`) THEN CLICK `#start` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-49-3) IF (`localStorage.getItem("user")`) THEN GO /dashboard``

**Notes:** - JavaScript executes in browser context - Must return boolean value - Access to all browser APIs and globals

* * *

#### `REPEAT (<command>, <count>)`

Repeat a command a specific number of times.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-50-1) REPEAT (<command>, <count>)`

**Parameters:** - `command` - Command to repeat - `count` - Number of times to repeat (number)

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-51-1) REPEAT (SCROLL DOWN 300, 5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-51-2) REPEAT (PRESS Tab, 3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-51-3) REPEAT (CLICK `.load-more`, 10)``

**Notes:** - Executes command exactly count times - Useful for pagination, scrolling, navigation - No delay between repetitions (add WAIT if needed)

* * *

#### `REPEAT (<command>, <condition>)`

Repeat a command while condition is true.

**Syntax:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-52-1) REPEAT (<command>, `<condition>`)``

**Parameters:** - `command` - Command to repeat - `condition` - JavaScript condition to check (string in backticks)

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-53-1) REPEAT (SCROLL DOWN 500, `document.querySelector(".load-more")`) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-53-2) REPEAT (PRESS ArrowDown, `window.scrollY < document.body.scrollHeight`)``

**Notes:** - Condition checked before each iteration - JavaScript condition must return boolean - Be careful to avoid infinite loops

### 💾 Variables and Data

Store and manipulate data within scripts.

#### `SETVAR <name> = "<value>"`

Create or update a variable.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-54-1) SETVAR <name> = "<value>"`

**Parameters:** - `name` - Variable name (alphanumeric, underscore) - `value` - Variable value (string in quotes)

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-55-1) SETVAR username = "john@example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-55-2) SETVAR password = "secret123" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-55-3) SETVAR base_url = "https://api.example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-55-4) SETVAR counter = "0"`

**Notes:** - Variables are global within script scope - Values are always strings - Can be used with TYPE command using $variable syntax

* * *

#### `EVAL <javascript>`

Execute arbitrary JavaScript code.

**Syntax:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-56-1) EVAL `<javascript>` ``

**Parameters:** - `javascript` - JavaScript code to execute (string in backticks)

**Examples:**

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-57-1) EVAL `console.log("Script started")` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-57-2) EVAL `window.scrollTo(0, 0)` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-57-3) EVAL `localStorage.setItem("test", "value")` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-57-4) EVAL `document.title = "Automated Test"` ``

**Notes:** - Full access to browser JavaScript APIs - Useful for custom logic and debugging - Return values are not captured - Be careful with security implications

### 📝 Comments and Documentation

#### `# <comment>`

Add comments to scripts for documentation.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-58-1) # <comment text>`

**Examples:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-59-1) # This script logs into the application [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-59-2) # Step 1: Navigate to login page [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-59-3) GO /login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-59-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-59-5) # Step 2: Fill credentials [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-59-6) TYPE "user@example.com"`

**Notes:** - Comments are ignored during execution - Useful for documentation and debugging - Can appear anywhere in script - Supports multi-line documentation blocks

### 🔧 Procedures (Advanced)

Define reusable command sequences.

#### `PROC <name> ... ENDPROC`

Define a reusable procedure.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-60-1) PROC <name> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-60-2)   <commands> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-60-3) ENDPROC`

**Parameters:** - `name` - Procedure name (alphanumeric, underscore) - `commands` - Commands to include in procedure

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-1) PROC login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-2)   CLICK `#email` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-3)   TYPE $email [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-4)   CLICK `#password` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-5)   TYPE $password [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-6)   CLICK `#submit` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-7) ENDPROC [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-9) PROC handle_popups [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-10)   IF (EXISTS `.cookie-banner`) THEN CLICK `.accept` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-11)   IF (EXISTS `.newsletter-modal`) THEN CLICK `.close` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-61-12) ENDPROC``

**Notes:** - Procedures must be defined before use - Support nested command structures - Variables are shared with main script scope

* * *

#### `<procedure_name>`

Call a defined procedure.

**Syntax:**

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-62-1) <procedure_name>`

**Examples:**

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-1) # Define procedure first [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-2) PROC setup [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-3)   GO /login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-4)   WAIT `#form` 5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-5) ENDPROC [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-7) # Call procedure [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-8) setup [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-63-9) login``

**Notes:** - Procedure must be defined before calling - Can be called multiple times - No parameters supported (use variables instead)

Error Handling Best Practices
-----------------------------

### 1\. Always Use Waits

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-64-1) # Bad - element might not be ready [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-64-2) CLICK `#button` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-64-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-64-4) # Good - wait for element first [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-64-5) WAIT `#button` 5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-64-6) CLICK `#button` ``

### 2\. Handle Optional Elements

`` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-65-1) # Check before interacting [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-65-2) IF (EXISTS `.popup`) THEN CLICK `.close` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-65-3) IF (EXISTS `.cookie-banner`) THEN CLICK `.accept` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-65-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-65-5) # Then proceed with main flow [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-65-6) CLICK `#main-action` ``

### 3\. Use Descriptive Variables

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-1) # Set up reusable data [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-2) SETVAR admin_email = "admin@company.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-3) SETVAR test_password = "TestPass123!" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-4) SETVAR staging_url = "https://staging.example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-6) # Use throughout script [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-7) GO $staging_url [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-66-8) TYPE $admin_email`

### 4\. Add Debugging Information

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-1) # Log progress [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-2) EVAL `console.log("Starting login process")` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-3) GO /login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-5) # Verify page state [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-6) IF (`document.title.includes("Login")`) THEN EVAL `console.log("On login page")` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-8) # Continue with login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-67-9) TYPE $username``

Common Patterns
---------------

### Login Flow

``[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-1) # Complete login automation [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-2) SETVAR email = "user@example.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-3) SETVAR password = "mypassword" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-5) GO /login [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-6) WAIT `#login-form` 5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-8) # Handle optional cookie banner [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-9) IF (EXISTS `.cookie-banner`) THEN CLICK `.accept-cookies` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-11) # Fill and submit form [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-12) CLICK `#email` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-13) TYPE $email [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-14) PRESS Tab [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-15) TYPE $password [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-16) CLICK `button[type="submit"]` [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-18) # Wait for redirect [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/api/c4a-script-reference/#__codelineno-68-19) WAIT `.dashboard` 10``

### Infinite Scroll
