# Link & Media - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

Link & Media
============

In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to:

1.  Extract links (internal, external) from crawled pages
2.  Filter or exclude specific domains (e.g., social media or custom domains)
3.  Access and ma### 3.2 Excluding Images

#### Excluding External Images

If you're dealing with heavy pages or want to skip third-party images (advertisements, for example), you can turn on:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-0-1) crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-0-2)     exclude_external_images=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-0-3) )`

This setting attempts to discard images from outside the primary domain, keeping only those from the site you're crawling.

#### Excluding All Images

If you want to completely remove all images from the page to maximize performance and reduce memory usage, use:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-1-1) crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-1-2)     exclude_all_images=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-1-3) )`

This setting removes all images very early in the processing pipeline, which significantly improves memory efficiency and processing speed. This is particularly useful when: - You don't need image data in your results - You're crawling image-heavy pages that cause memory issues - You want to focus only on text content - You need to maximize crawling speeddata (especially images) in the crawl result  
4\. Configure your crawler to exclude or prioritize certain images

> **Prerequisites**  
> \- You have completed or are familiar with the [AsyncWebCrawler Basics](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/simple-crawling/)
>  tutorial.  
> \- You can run Crawl4AI in your environment (Playwright, Python, etc.).

* * *

Below is a revised version of the **Link Extraction** and **Media Extraction** sections that includes example data structures showing how links and media items are stored in `CrawlResult`. Feel free to adjust any field names or descriptions to match your actual output.

* * *

1\. Link Extraction
-------------------

### 1.1 `result.links`

When you call `arun()` or `arun_many()` on a URL, Crawl4AI automatically extracts links and stores them in the `links` field of `CrawlResult`. By default, the crawler tries to distinguish **internal** links (same domain) from **external** links (different domains).

**Basic Example**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-3) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-4)     result = await crawler.arun("https://www.example.com") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-5)     if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-6)         internal_links = result.links.get("internal", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-7)         external_links = result.links.get("external", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-8)         print(f"Found {len(internal_links)} internal links.") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-9)         print(f"Found {len(internal_links)} external links.") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-10)         print(f"Found {len(result.media)} media items.") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-12)         # Each link is typically a dictionary with fields like: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-13)         # { "href": "...", "text": "...", "title": "...", "base_domain": "..." } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-14)         if internal_links: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-15)             print("Sample Internal Link:", internal_links[0]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-16)     else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-2-17)         print("Crawl failed:", result.error_message)`

**Structure Example**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-1) result.links = { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-2)   "internal": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-3)     { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-4)       "href": "https://kidocode.com/", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-5)       "text": "", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-6)       "title": "", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-7)       "base_domain": "kidocode.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-8)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-9)     { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-10)       "href": "https://kidocode.com/degrees/technology", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-11)       "text": "Technology Degree", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-12)       "title": "KidoCode Tech Program", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-13)       "base_domain": "kidocode.com" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-14)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-15)     # ... [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-16)   ], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-17)   "external": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-18)     # possibly other links leading to third-party sites [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-19)   ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-3-20) }`

*   **`href`**: The raw hyperlink URL.
*   **`text`**: The link text (if any) within the `<a>` tag.
*   **`title`**: The `title` attribute of the link (if present).
*   **`base_domain`**: The domain extracted from `href`. Helpful for filtering or grouping by domain.

* * *

2\. Advanced Link Head Extraction & Scoring
-------------------------------------------

Ever wanted to not just extract links, but also get the actual content (title, description, metadata) from those linked pages? And score them for relevance? This is exactly what Link Head Extraction does - it fetches the `<head>` section from each discovered link and scores them using multiple algorithms.

### 2.1 Why Link Head Extraction?

When you crawl a page, you get hundreds of links. But which ones are actually valuable? Link Head Extraction solves this by:

1.  **Fetching head content** from each link (title, description, meta tags)
2.  **Scoring links intrinsically** based on URL quality, text relevance, and context
3.  **Scoring links contextually** using BM25 algorithm when you provide a search query
4.  **Combining scores intelligently** to give you a final relevance ranking

### 2.2 Complete Working Example

Here's a full example you can copy, paste, and run immediately:

### 2.4 Understanding the Three Score Types

Each extracted link gets three different scores:

#### 1\. **Intrinsic Score (0-10)** - URL and Content Quality

Based on URL structure, link text quality, and page context:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-1) # High intrinsic score indicators: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-2) # ✅ Clean URL structure (docs.python.org/api/reference) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-3) # ✅ Meaningful link text ("API Reference Guide") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-4) # ✅ Relevant to page context [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-5) # ✅ Not buried deep in navigation [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-7) # Low intrinsic score indicators: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-8) # ❌ Random URLs (site.com/x7f9g2h) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-9) # ❌ No link text or generic text ("Click here") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-7-10) # ❌ Unrelated to page content`

#### 2\. **Contextual Score (0-1)** - BM25 Relevance to Query

Only available when you provide a `query`. Uses BM25 algorithm against head content:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-8-1) # Example: query = "machine learning tutorial" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-8-2) # High contextual score: Link to "Complete Machine Learning Guide" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-8-3) # Low contextual score: Link to "Privacy Policy"`

#### 3\. **Total Score** - Smart Combination

Intelligently combines intrinsic and contextual scores with fallbacks:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-9-1) # When both scores available: (intrinsic * 0.3) + (contextual * 0.7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-9-2) # When only intrinsic: uses intrinsic score [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-9-3) # When only contextual: uses contextual score [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-9-4) # When neither: not calculated`

### 2.6 Performance Tips

1.  **Start Small**: Begin with `max_links: 10` to understand the feature
2.  **Use Patterns**: Filter with `include_patterns` to focus on relevant sections
3.  **Adjust Concurrency**: Higher concurrency = faster but more resource usage
4.  **Set Timeouts**: Use `timeout: 5` to prevent hanging on slow sites
5.  **Use Score Thresholds**: Filter out low-quality links with `score_threshold`

3\. Domain Filtering
--------------------

Some websites contain hundreds of third-party or affiliate links. You can filter out certain domains at **crawl time** by configuring the crawler. The most relevant parameters in `CrawlerRunConfig` are:

*   **`exclude_external_links`**: If `True`, discard any link pointing outside the root domain.
*   **`exclude_social_media_domains`**: Provide a list of social media platforms (e.g., `["facebook.com", "twitter.com"]`) to exclude from your crawl.
*   **`exclude_social_media_links`**: If `True`, automatically skip known social platforms.
*   **`exclude_domains`**: Provide a list of custom domains you want to exclude (e.g., `["spammyads.com", "tracker.net"]`).

### 3.1 Example: Excluding External & Social Media Links

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-16-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-16-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, BrowserConfig, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-16-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-16-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-16-5)     crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-16-6)         exclude_external_links=True,          # ### 3.2 Example: Excluding Specific Domains

If you want to let external links in, but specifically exclude a domain (e.g., `suspiciousads.com`), do this:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-17-1) crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-17-2)     exclude_domains=["suspiciousads.com"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-17-3) )`

This approach is handy when you still want external links but need to block certain sites you consider spammy.

4\. Media Extraction
--------------------

### 4.1 Accessing `result.media`

By default, Crawl4AI collects images, audio, video URLs, and data tables it finds on the page. These are stored in `result.media`, a dictionary keyed by media type (e.g., `images`, `videos`, `audio`, `tables`).

**Basic Example**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-1) if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-2)     # Get images [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-3)     images_info = result.media.get("images", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-4)     print(f"Found {len(images_info)} images in total.") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-14)     for i, table in enumerate(tables): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-15)         print(f"[Table {i}] Caption: {table.get('caption', 'No caption')}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-16)         print(f"           Columns: {len(table.get('headers', []))}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-18-17)         print(f"           Rows: {len(table.get('rows', []))}")`

**Structure Example**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-1) result.media = { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-2)   "images": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-3)     { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-4)       "src": "https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/.../Group%2089.svg", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-5)       "alt": "coding school for kids", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-6)       "desc": "Trial Class Degrees degrees All Degrees AI Degree Technology ...", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-7)       "score": 3, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-8)       "type": "image", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-9)       "group_id": 0, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-10)       "format": None, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-11)       "width": None, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-12)       "height": None [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-13)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-14)     # ... [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-15)   ], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-16)   "videos": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-17)     # Similar structure but with video-specific fields [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-18)   ], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-19)   "audio": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-20)     # Similar structure but with audio-specific fields [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-21)   ], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-22)   "tables": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-23)     { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-24)       "headers": ["Name", "Age", "Location"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-25)       "rows": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-26)         ["John Doe", "34", "New York"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-27)         ["Jane Smith", "28", "San Francisco"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-28)         ["Alex Johnson", "42", "Chicago"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-29)       ], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-30)       "caption": "Employee Directory", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-31)       "summary": "Directory of company employees" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-32)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-33)     # More tables if present [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-34)   ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-19-35) }`

Depending on your Crawl4AI version or scraping strategy, these dictionaries can include fields like:

*   **`src`**: The media URL (e.g., image source)
*   **`alt`**: The alt text for images (if present)
*   **`desc`**: A snippet of nearby text or a short description (optional)
*   **`score`**: A heuristic relevance score if you’re using content-scoring features
*   **`width`**, **`height`**: If the crawler detects dimensions for the image/video
*   **`type`**: Usually `"image"`, `"video"`, or `"audio"`
*   **`group_id`**: If you’re grouping related media items, the crawler might assign an ID

With these details, you can easily filter out or focus on certain images (for instance, ignoring images with very low scores or a different domain), or gather metadata for analytics.

### 4.2 Excluding External Images

If you’re dealing with heavy pages or want to skip third-party images (advertisements, for example), you can turn on:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-20-1) crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-20-2)     exclude_external_images=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-20-3) )`

This setting attempts to discard images from outside the primary domain, keeping only those from the site you’re crawling.

### 3.3 Working with Tables

Crawl4AI can detect and extract structured data from HTML tables. Tables are analyzed based on various criteria to determine if they are actual data tables (as opposed to layout tables), including:

*   Presence of thead and tbody sections
*   Use of th elements for headers
*   Column consistency
*   Text density
*   And other factors

Tables that score above the threshold (default: 7) are extracted and stored in `result.media.tables`.

**Accessing Table Data**:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-1) if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-2)     tables = result.media.get("tables", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-3)     print(f"Found {len(tables)} data tables on the page") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-5)     if tables: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-6)         # Access the first table [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-7)         first_table = tables[0] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-8)         print(f"Table caption: {first_table.get('caption', 'No caption')}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-9)         print(f"Headers: {first_table.get('headers', [])}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-11)         # Print the first 3 rows [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-12)         for i, row in enumerate(first_table.get('rows', [])[:3]): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-21-13)             print(f"Row {i+1}: {row}")`

**Configuring Table Extraction**:

You can adjust the sensitivity of the table detection algorithm with:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-22-1) crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-22-2)     table_score_threshold=5  # Lower value = more tables detected (default: 7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-22-3) )`

Each extracted table contains: - `headers`: Column header names - `rows`: List of rows, each containing cell values - `caption`: Table caption text (if available) - `summary`: Table summary attribute (if specified)

### 3.4 Additional Media Config

*   **`screenshot`**: Set to `True` if you want a full-page screenshot stored as `base64` in `result.screenshot`.
*   **`pdf`**: Set to `True` if you want a PDF version of the page in `result.pdf`.
*   **`capture_mhtml`**: Set to `True` if you want an MHTML snapshot of the page in `result.mhtml`. This format preserves the entire web page with all its resources (CSS, images, scripts) in a single file, making it perfect for archiving or offline viewing.
*   **`wait_for_images`**: If `True`, attempts to wait until images are fully loaded before final extraction.

#### Example: Capturing Page as MHTML

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-5)     crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-6)         capture_mhtml=True  # Enable MHTML capture [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-7)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-9)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-10)         result = await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=crawler_cfg) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-12)         if result.success and result.mhtml: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-13)             # Save the MHTML snapshot to a file [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-14)             with open("example.mhtml", "w", encoding="utf-8") as f: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-15)                 f.write(result.mhtml) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-16)             print("MHTML snapshot saved to example.mhtml") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-17)         else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-18)             print("Failed to capture MHTML:", result.error_message) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-19) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-20) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-23-21)     asyncio.run(main())`

The MHTML format is particularly useful because: - It captures the complete page state including all resources - It can be opened in most modern browsers for offline viewing - It preserves the page exactly as it appeared during crawling - It's a single file, making it easy to store and transfer

* * *

4\. Putting It All Together: Link & Media Filtering
---------------------------------------------------

Here’s a combined example demonstrating how to filter out external links, skip certain domains, and exclude external images:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, BrowserConfig, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-4) async def main(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-5)     # Suppose we want to keep only internal links, remove certain domains,  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-6)     # and discard external images from the final crawl data. [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-7)     crawler_cfg = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-8)         exclude_external_links=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-9)         exclude_domains=["spammyads.com"], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-10)         exclude_social_media_links=True,   # skip Twitter, Facebook, etc. [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-11)         exclude_external_images=True,      # keep only images from main domain [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-12)         wait_for_images=True,             # ensure images are loaded [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-13)         verbose=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-14)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-16)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-17)         result = await crawler.arun("https://www.example.com", config=crawler_cfg) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-18) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-19)         if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-20)             print("[OK] Crawled:", result.url) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-21) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-22)             # 1. Links [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-23)             in_links = result.links.get("internal", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-24)             ext_links = result.links.get("external", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-25)             print("Internal link count:", len(in_links)) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-26)             print("External link count:", len(ext_links))  # should be zero with exclude_external_links=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-27) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-28)             # 2. Images [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-29)             images = result.media.get("images", []) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-30)             print("Images found:", len(images)) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-31) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-32)             # Let's see a snippet of these images [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-33)             for i, img in enumerate(images[:3]): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-34)                 print(f"  - {img['src']} (alt={img.get('alt','')}, score={img.get('score','N/A')})") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-35)         else: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-36)             print("[ERROR] Failed to crawl. Reason:", result.error_message) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-37) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-38) if __name__ == "__main__": [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/link-media/#__codelineno-24-39)     asyncio.run(main())`

* * *

5\. Common Pitfalls & Tips
--------------------------

1. **Conflicting Flags**:  
\- `exclude_external_links=True` but then also specifying `exclude_social_media_links=True` is typically fine, but understand that the first setting already discards _all_ external links. The second becomes somewhat redundant.  
\- `exclude_external_images=True` but want to keep some external images? Currently no partial domain-based setting for images, so you might need a custom approach or hook logic.

2. **Relevancy Scores**:  
\- If your version of Crawl4AI or your scraping strategy includes an `img["score"]`, it’s typically a heuristic based on size, position, or content analysis. Evaluate carefully if you rely on it.

3. **Performance**:  
\- Excluding certain domains or external images can speed up your crawl, especially for large, media-heavy pages.  
\- If you want a “full” link map, do _not_ exclude them. Instead, you can post-filter in your own code.

4. **Social Media Lists**:  
\- `exclude_social_media_links=True` typically references an internal list of known social domains like Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc. If you need to add or remove from that list, look for library settings or a local config file (depending on your version).

* * *

**That’s it for Link & Media Analysis!** You’re now equipped to filter out unwanted sites and zero in on the images and videos that matter for your project.

### Table Extraction Tips

*   Not all HTML tables are extracted - only those detected as "data tables" vs. layout tables.
*   Tables with inconsistent cell counts, nested tables, or those used purely for layout may be skipped.
*   If you're missing tables, try adjusting the `table_score_threshold` to a lower value (default is 7).

The table detection algorithm scores tables based on features like consistent columns, presence of headers, text density, and more. Tables scoring above the threshold are considered data tables worth extracting.

# URL Seeding - Crawl4AI Documentation (v0.7.x)

URL Seeding: The Smart Way to Crawl at Scale
============================================

Why URL Seeding?
----------------

Web crawling comes in different flavors, each with its own strengths. Let's understand when to use URL seeding versus deep crawling.

### Deep Crawling: Real-Time Discovery

Deep crawling is perfect when you need: - **Fresh, real-time data** - discovering pages as they're created - **Dynamic exploration** - following links based on content - **Selective extraction** - stopping when you find what you need

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-1) # Deep crawling example: Explore a website dynamically [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-2) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-3) from crawl4ai import AsyncWebCrawler, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-4) from crawl4ai.deep_crawling import BFSDeepCrawlStrategy [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-6) async def deep_crawl_example(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-7)     # Configure a 2-level deep crawl [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-8)     config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-9)         deep_crawl_strategy=BFSDeepCrawlStrategy( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-10)             max_depth=2,           # Crawl 2 levels deep [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-11)             include_external=False, # Stay within domain [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-12)             max_pages=50           # Limit for efficiency [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-13)         ), [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-14)         verbose=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-15)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-16) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-17)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-18)         # Start crawling and follow links dynamically [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-19)         results = await crawler.arun("https://example.com", config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-20) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-21)         print(f"Discovered and crawled {len(results)} pages") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-22)         for result in results[:3]: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-23)             print(f"Found: {result.url} at depth {result.metadata.get('depth', 0)}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-24) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-0-25) asyncio.run(deep_crawl_example())`

### URL Seeding: Bulk Discovery

URL seeding shines when you want: - **Comprehensive coverage** - get thousands of URLs in seconds - **Bulk processing** - filter before crawling - **Resource efficiency** - know exactly what you'll crawl

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-1) # URL seeding example: Analyze all documentation [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncUrlSeeder, SeedingConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-4) seeder = AsyncUrlSeeder() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-5) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-6)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-7)     extract_head=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-8)     pattern="*/docs/*" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-9) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-11) # Get ALL documentation URLs instantly [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-12) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-1-13) # 1000+ URLs discovered in seconds!`

### The Trade-offs

| Aspect | Deep Crawling | URL Seeding |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Coverage** | Discovers pages dynamically | Gets most existing URLs instantly |
| **Freshness** | Finds brand new pages | May miss very recent pages |
| **Speed** | Slower, page by page | Extremely fast bulk discovery |
| **Resource Usage** | Higher - crawls to discover | Lower - discovers then crawls |
| **Control** | Can stop mid-process | Pre-filters before crawling |

### When to Use Each

**Choose Deep Crawling when:** - You need the absolute latest content - You're searching for specific information - The site structure is unknown or dynamic - You want to stop as soon as you find what you need

**Choose URL Seeding when:** - You need to analyze large portions of a site - You want to filter URLs before crawling - You're doing comparative analysis - You need to optimize resource usage

The magic happens when you understand both approaches and choose the right tool for your task. Sometimes, you might even combine them - use URL seeding for bulk discovery, then deep crawl specific sections for the latest updates.

Your First URL Seeding Adventure
--------------------------------

Let's see the magic in action. We'll discover blog posts about Python, filter for tutorials, and crawl only those pages.

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-1) import asyncio [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-2) from crawl4ai import AsyncUrlSeeder, AsyncWebCrawler, SeedingConfig, CrawlerRunConfig [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-4) async def smart_blog_crawler(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-5)     # Step 1: Create our URL discoverer [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-6)     seeder = AsyncUrlSeeder() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-8)     # Step 2: Configure discovery - let's find all blog posts [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-9)     config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-10)         source="sitemap",           # Use the website's sitemap [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-11)         pattern="*/blog/*.html",    # Only blog posts [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-12)         extract_head=True,          # Get page metadata [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-13)         max_urls=100               # Limit for this example [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-14)     ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-16)     # Step 3: Discover URLs from the Python blog [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-17)     print("🔍 Discovering blog posts...") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-18)     urls = await seeder.urls("realpython.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-19)     print(f"✅ Found {len(urls)} blog posts") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-20) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-21)     # Step 4: Filter for Python tutorials (using metadata!) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-22)     tutorials = [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-23)         url for url in urls  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-24)         if url["status"] == "valid" and  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-25)         any(keyword in str(url["head_data"]).lower()  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-26)             for keyword in ["tutorial", "guide", "how to"]) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-27)     ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-28)     print(f"📚 Filtered to {len(tutorials)} tutorials") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-29) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-30)     # Step 5: Show what we found [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-31)     print("\n🎯 Found these tutorials:") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-32)     for tutorial in tutorials[:5]:  # First 5 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-33)         title = tutorial["head_data"].get("title", "No title") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-34)         print(f"  - {title}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-35)         print(f"    {tutorial['url']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-36) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-37)     # Step 6: Now crawl ONLY these relevant pages [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-38)     print("\n🚀 Crawling tutorials...") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-39)     async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-40)         config = CrawlerRunConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-41)             only_text=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-42)             word_count_threshold=300  # Only substantial articles [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-43)         ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-44) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-45)         # Extract URLs and stream results as they come [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-46)         tutorial_urls = [t["url"] for t in tutorials[:10]] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-47)         results = await crawler.arun_many(tutorial_urls, config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-48) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-49)         successful = 0 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-50)         async for result in results: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-51)             if result.success: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-52)                 successful += 1 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-53)                 print(f"✓ Crawled: {result.url[:60]}...") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-54) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-55)         print(f"\n✨ Successfully crawled {successful} tutorials!") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-56) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-57) # Run it! [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-2-58) asyncio.run(smart_blog_crawler())`

**What just happened?**

1.  We discovered all blog URLs from the sitemap
2.  We filtered using metadata (no crawling needed!)
3.  We crawled only the relevant tutorials
4.  We saved tons of time and bandwidth

This is the power of URL seeding - you see everything before you crawl anything.

Understanding the URL Seeder
----------------------------

Now that you've seen the magic, let's understand how it works.

### Basic Usage

Creating a URL seeder is simple:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-1) from crawl4ai import AsyncUrlSeeder [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-2) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-3) # Method 1: Manual cleanup [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-4) seeder = AsyncUrlSeeder() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-5) try: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-6)     config = SeedingConfig(source="sitemap") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-7)     urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-8) finally: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-9)     await seeder.close() [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-11) # Method 2: Context manager (recommended) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-12) async with AsyncUrlSeeder() as seeder: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-13)     config = SeedingConfig(source="sitemap") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-14)     urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-3-15)     # Automatically cleaned up on exit`

The seeder can discover URLs from two powerful sources:

#### 1\. Sitemaps (Fastest)

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-4-1) # Discover from sitemap [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-4-2) config = SeedingConfig(source="sitemap") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-4-3) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config)`

Sitemaps are XML files that websites create specifically to list all their URLs. It's like getting a menu at a restaurant - everything is listed upfront.

**Sitemap Index Support**: For large websites like TechCrunch that use sitemap indexes (a sitemap of sitemaps), the seeder automatically detects and processes all sub-sitemaps in parallel:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-1) <!-- Example sitemap index --> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-2) <sitemapindex> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-3)   <sitemap> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-4)     <loc>https://techcrunch.com/sitemap-1.xml</loc> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-5)   </sitemap> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-6)   <sitemap> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-7)     <loc>https://techcrunch.com/sitemap-2.xml</loc> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-8)   </sitemap> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-9)   <!-- ... more sitemaps ... --> [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-5-10) </sitemapindex>`

The seeder handles this transparently - you'll get all URLs from all sub-sitemaps automatically!

#### 2\. Common Crawl (Most Comprehensive)

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-6-1) # Discover from Common Crawl [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-6-2) config = SeedingConfig(source="cc") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-6-3) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config)`

Common Crawl is a massive public dataset that regularly crawls the entire web. It's like having access to a pre-built index of the internet.

#### 3\. Both Sources (Maximum Coverage)

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-7-1) # Use both sources [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-7-2) config = SeedingConfig(source="cc+sitemap") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-7-3) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config)`

### Configuration Magic: SeedingConfig

The `SeedingConfig` object is your control panel. Here's everything you can configure:

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `source` | str | "cc" | URL source: "cc" (Common Crawl), "sitemap", or "cc+sitemap" |
| `pattern` | str | "\*" | URL pattern filter (e.g., "_/blog/_", "\*.html") |
| `extract_head` | bool | False | Extract metadata from page `<head>` |
| `live_check` | bool | False | Verify URLs are accessible |
| `max_urls` | int | \-1 | Maximum URLs to return (-1 = unlimited) |
| `concurrency` | int | 10  | Parallel workers for fetching |
| `hits_per_sec` | int | None | Rate limit for requests |
| `force` | bool | False | Bypass cache, fetch fresh data |
| `verbose` | bool | False | Show detailed progress |
| `query` | str | None | Search query for BM25 scoring |
| `scoring_method` | str | None | Scoring method (currently "bm25") |
| `score_threshold` | float | None | Minimum score to include URL |
| `filter_nonsense_urls` | bool | True | Filter out utility URLs (robots.txt, etc.) |

#### Pattern Matching Examples

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-1) # Match all blog posts [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-2) config = SeedingConfig(pattern="*/blog/*") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-4) # Match only HTML files [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-5) config = SeedingConfig(pattern="*.html") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-7) # Match product pages [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-8) config = SeedingConfig(pattern="*/product/*") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-10) # Match everything except admin pages [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-11) config = SeedingConfig(pattern="*") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-8-12) # Then filter: urls = [u for u in urls if "/admin/" not in u["url"]]`

### URL Validation: Live Checking

Sometimes you need to know if URLs are actually accessible. That's where live checking comes in:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-1) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-2)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-3)     live_check=True,  # Verify each URL is accessible [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-4)     concurrency=20    # Check 20 URLs in parallel [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-7) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-9) # Now you can filter by status [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-10) live_urls = [u for u in urls if u["status"] == "valid"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-11) dead_urls = [u for u in urls if u["status"] == "not_valid"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-13) print(f"Live URLs: {len(live_urls)}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-9-14) print(f"Dead URLs: {len(dead_urls)}")`

**When to use live checking:** - Before a large crawling operation - When working with older sitemaps - When data freshness is critical

**When to skip it:** - Quick explorations - When you trust the source - When speed is more important than accuracy

### The Power of Metadata: Head Extraction

This is where URL seeding gets really powerful. Instead of crawling entire pages, you can extract just the metadata:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-1) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-2)     extract_head=True  # Extract metadata from <head> section [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-3) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-5) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-7) # Now each URL has rich metadata [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-8) for url in urls[:3]: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-9)     print(f"\nURL: {url['url']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-10)     print(f"Title: {url['head_data'].get('title')}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-12)     meta = url['head_data'].get('meta', {}) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-13)     print(f"Description: {meta.get('description')}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-14)     print(f"Keywords: {meta.get('keywords')}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-15) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-16)     # Even Open Graph data! [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-10-17)     print(f"OG Image: {meta.get('og:image')}")`

#### What Can We Extract?

The head extraction gives you a treasure trove of information:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-1) # Example of extracted head_data [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-2) { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-3)     "title": "10 Python Tips for Beginners", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-4)     "charset": "utf-8", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-5)     "lang": "en", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-6)     "meta": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-7)         "description": "Learn essential Python tips...", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-8)         "keywords": "python, programming, tutorial", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-9)         "author": "Jane Developer", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-10)         "viewport": "width=device-width, initial-scale=1", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-12)         # Open Graph tags [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-13)         "og:title": "10 Python Tips for Beginners", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-14)         "og:description": "Essential Python tips for new programmers", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-15)         "og:image": "https://example.com/python-tips.jpg", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-16)         "og:type": "article", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-18)         # Twitter Card tags [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-19)         "twitter:card": "summary_large_image", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-20)         "twitter:title": "10 Python Tips", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-21) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-22)         # Dublin Core metadata [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-23)         "dc.creator": "Jane Developer", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-24)         "dc.date": "2024-01-15" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-25)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-26)     "link": { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-27)         "canonical": [{"href": "https://example.com/blog/python-tips"}], [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-28)         "alternate": [{"href": "/feed.xml", "type": "application/rss+xml"}] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-29)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-30)     "jsonld": [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-31)         { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-32)             "@type": "Article", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-33)             "headline": "10 Python Tips for Beginners", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-34)             "datePublished": "2024-01-15", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-35)             "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jane Developer"} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-36)         } [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-37)     ] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-11-38) }`

This metadata is gold for filtering! You can find exactly what you need without crawling a single page.

### Smart URL-Based Filtering (No Head Extraction)

When `extract_head=False` but you still provide a query, the seeder uses intelligent URL-based scoring:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-1) # Fast filtering based on URL structure alone [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-3)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-4)     extract_head=False,  # Don't fetch page metadata [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-5)     query="python tutorial async", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-6)     scoring_method="bm25", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-7)     score_threshold=0.3 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-10) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-12) # URLs are scored based on: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-13) # 1. Domain parts matching (e.g., 'python' in python.example.com) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-14) # 2. Path segments (e.g., '/tutorials/python-async/') [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-15) # 3. Query parameters (e.g., '?topic=python') [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-16) # 4. Fuzzy matching using character n-grams [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-18) # Example URL scoring: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-19) # https://example.com/tutorials/python/async-guide.html - High score [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-12-20) # https://example.com/blog/javascript-tips.html - Low score`

This approach is much faster than head extraction while still providing intelligent filtering!

### Understanding Results

Each URL in the results has this structure:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-1) { [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-2)     "url": "https://example.com/blog/python-tips.html", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-3)     "status": "valid",        # "valid", "not_valid", or "unknown" [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-4)     "head_data": {            # Only if extract_head=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-5)         "title": "Page Title", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-6)         "meta": {...}, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-7)         "link": {...}, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-8)         "jsonld": [...] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-9)     }, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-10)     "relevance_score": 0.85   # Only if using BM25 scoring [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-13-11) }`

Smart Filtering with BM25 Scoring
---------------------------------

Now for the really cool part - intelligent filtering based on relevance!

### Introduction to Relevance Scoring

BM25 is a ranking algorithm that scores how relevant a document is to a search query. With URL seeding, we can score URLs based on their metadata _before_ crawling them.

Think of it like this: - Traditional way: Read every book in the library to find ones about Python - Smart way: Check the titles and descriptions, score them, read only the most relevant

### Query-Based Discovery

Here's how to use BM25 scoring:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-1) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-2)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-3)     extract_head=True,           # Required for scoring [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-4)     query="python async tutorial",  # What we're looking for [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-5)     scoring_method="bm25",       # Use BM25 algorithm [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-6)     score_threshold=0.3          # Minimum relevance score [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-7) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-8) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-9) urls = await seeder.urls("realpython.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-11) # Results are automatically sorted by relevance! [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-12) for url in urls[:5]: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-13)     print(f"Score: {url['relevance_score']:.2f} - {url['url']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-15-14)     print(f"  Title: {url['head_data']['title']}")`

### Real Examples

#### Finding Documentation Pages

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-1) # Find API documentation [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-3)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-4)     extract_head=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-5)     query="API reference documentation endpoints", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-6)     scoring_method="bm25", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-7)     score_threshold=0.5, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-8)     max_urls=20 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-9) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-11) urls = await seeder.urls("docs.example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-16-13) # The highest scoring URLs will be API docs!`

#### Discovering Product Pages

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-1) # Find specific products [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-3)     source="cc+sitemap",  # Use both sources [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-4)     extract_head=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-5)     query="wireless headphones noise canceling", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-6)     scoring_method="bm25", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-7)     score_threshold=0.4, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-8)     pattern="*/product/*"  # Combine with pattern matching [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-9) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-10) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-11) urls = await seeder.urls("shop.example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-12) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-13) # Filter further by price (from metadata) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-14) affordable = [ [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-15)     u for u in urls  [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-16)     if float(u['head_data'].get('meta', {}).get('product:price', '0')) < 200 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-17-17) ]`

#### Filtering News Articles

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-1) # Find recent news about AI [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-3)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-4)     extract_head=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-5)     query="artificial intelligence machine learning breakthrough", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-6)     scoring_method="bm25", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-7)     score_threshold=0.35 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-8) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-9) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-10) urls = await seeder.urls("technews.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-12) # Filter by date [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-13) from datetime import datetime, timedelta [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-14) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-15) recent = [] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-16) cutoff = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-17) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-18) for url in urls: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-19)     # Check JSON-LD for publication date [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-20)     for jsonld in url['head_data'].get('jsonld', []): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-21)         if 'datePublished' in jsonld: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-22)             pub_date = datetime.fromisoformat(jsonld['datePublished'].replace('Z', '+00:00')) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-23)             if pub_date > cutoff: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-24)                 recent.append(url) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-18-25)                 break`

Scaling Up: Multiple Domains
----------------------------

When you need to discover URLs across multiple websites, URL seeding really shines.

### The `many_urls` Method

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-1) # Discover URLs from multiple domains in parallel [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-2) domains = ["site1.com", "site2.com", "site3.com"] [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-4) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-5)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-6)     extract_head=True, [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-7)     query="python tutorial", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-8)     scoring_method="bm25", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-9)     score_threshold=0.3 [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-10) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-12) # Returns a dictionary: {domain: [urls]} [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-13) results = await seeder.many_urls(domains, config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-14) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-15) # Process results [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-16) for domain, urls in results.items(): [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-17)     print(f"\n{domain}: Found {len(urls)} relevant URLs") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-18)     if urls: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-19)         top = urls[0]  # Highest scoring [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-20)         print(f"  Top result: {top['url']}") [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-20-21)         print(f"  Score: {top['relevance_score']:.2f}")`

### Performance Optimization Tips

1.  **Use caching wisely**
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-1) # First run - populate cache [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-2) config = SeedingConfig(source="sitemap", extract_head=True, force=True) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-3) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-5) # Subsequent runs - use cache (much faster) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-6) config = SeedingConfig(source="sitemap", extract_head=True, force=False) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-25-7) urls = await seeder.urls("example.com", config)`
    
2.  **Optimize concurrency**
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-26-1) # For many small requests (like HEAD checks) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-26-2) config = SeedingConfig(concurrency=50, hits_per_sec=20) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-26-3) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-26-4) # For fewer large requests (like full head extraction) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-26-5) config = SeedingConfig(concurrency=10, hits_per_sec=5)`
    
3.  **Stream large result sets**
    
    `[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-1) # When crawling many URLs [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-2) async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-3)     # Assuming urls is a list of URL strings [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-4)     results = await crawler.arun_many(urls, config=config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-5) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-6)     # Process as they arrive [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-7)     async for result in results: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-27-8)         process_immediately(result)  # Don't wait for all`
    
4.  **Memory protection for large domains**
    

The seeder uses bounded queues to prevent memory issues when processing domains with millions of URLs:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-1) # Safe for domains with 1M+ URLs [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-3)     source="cc+sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-4)     concurrency=50,  # Queue size adapts to concurrency [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-5)     max_urls=100000  # Process in batches if needed [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-6) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-7) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-8) # The seeder automatically manages memory by: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-9) # - Using bounded queues (prevents RAM spikes) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-10) # - Applying backpressure when queue is full [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-28-11) # - Processing URLs as they're discovered`

Best Practices & Tips
---------------------

### Cache Management

The seeder automatically caches results to speed up repeated operations:

*   **Common Crawl cache**: `~/.crawl4ai/seeder_cache/[index]_[domain]_[hash].jsonl`
*   **Sitemap cache**: `~/.crawl4ai/seeder_cache/sitemap_[domain]_[hash].jsonl`
*   **HEAD data cache**: `~/.cache/url_seeder/head/[hash].json`

Cache expires after 7 days by default. Use `force=True` to refresh.

### Pattern Matching Strategies

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-1) # Be specific when possible [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-2) good_pattern = "*/blog/2024/*.html"  # Specific [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-3) bad_pattern = "*"                     # Too broad [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-4) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-5) # Combine patterns with metadata filtering [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-6) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-7)     pattern="*/articles/*", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-8)     extract_head=True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-9) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-10) urls = await seeder.urls("news.com", config) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-11) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-12) # Further filter by publish date, author, category, etc. [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-29-13) recent = [u for u in urls if is_recent(u['head_data'])]`

### Rate Limiting Considerations

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-1) # Be respectful of servers [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-3)     hits_per_sec=10,      # Max 10 requests per second [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-4)     concurrency=20        # But use 20 workers [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-7) # For your own servers [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-8) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-9)     hits_per_sec=None,    # No limit [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-10)     concurrency=100       # Go fast [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-30-11) )`

Quick Reference
---------------

### Common Patterns

### Troubleshooting Guide

| Issue | Solution |
| --- | --- |
| No URLs found | Try `source="cc+sitemap"`, check domain spelling |
| Slow discovery | Reduce `concurrency`, add `hits_per_sec` limit |
| Missing metadata | Ensure `extract_head=True` |
| Low relevance scores | Refine query, lower `score_threshold` |
| Rate limit errors | Reduce `hits_per_sec` and `concurrency` |
| Memory issues with large sites | Use `max_urls` to limit results, reduce `concurrency` |
| Connection not closed | Use context manager or call `await seeder.close()` |

### Performance Benchmarks

Typical performance on a standard connection:

*   **Sitemap discovery**: 100-1,000 URLs/second
*   **Common Crawl discovery**: 50-500 URLs/second
*   **HEAD checking**: 10-50 URLs/second
*   **Head extraction**: 5-20 URLs/second
*   **BM25 scoring**: 10,000+ URLs/second

Conclusion
----------

URL seeding transforms web crawling from a blind expedition into a surgical strike. By discovering and analyzing URLs before crawling, you can:

*   Save hours of crawling time
*   Reduce bandwidth usage by 90%+
*   Find exactly what you need
*   Scale across multiple domains effortlessly

Whether you're building a research tool, monitoring competitors, or creating a content aggregator, URL seeding gives you the intelligence to crawl smarter, not harder.

### Smart URL Filtering

The seeder automatically filters out nonsense URLs that aren't useful for content crawling:

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-1) # Enabled by default [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-2) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-3)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-4)     filter_nonsense_urls=True  # Default: True [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-5) ) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-6) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-7) # URLs that get filtered: [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-8) # - robots.txt, sitemap.xml, ads.txt [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-9) # - API endpoints (/api/, /v1/, .json) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-10) # - Media files (.jpg, .mp4, .pdf) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-11) # - Archives (.zip, .tar.gz) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-12) # - Source code (.js, .css) [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-13) # - Admin/login pages [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-32-14) # - And many more...`

To disable filtering (not recommended):

`[](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-33-1) config = SeedingConfig( [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-33-2)     source="sitemap", [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-33-3)     filter_nonsense_urls=False  # Include ALL URLs [](https://docs.crawl4ai.com/core/url-seeding/#__codelineno-33-4) )`

### Key Features Summary

1.  **Parallel Sitemap Index Processing**: Automatically detects and processes sitemap indexes in parallel
2.  **Memory Protection**: Bounded queues prevent RAM issues with large domains (1M+ URLs)
3.  **Context Manager Support**: Automatic cleanup with `async with` statement
4.  **URL-Based Scoring**: Smart filtering even without head extraction
5.  **Smart URL Filtering**: Automatically excludes utility/nonsense URLs
6.  **Dual Caching**: Separate caches for URL lists and metadata

Now go forth and seed intelligently! 🌱🚀
